,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: </noinclude>'''VGA text mode''' was introduced in 1987 by IBM as part of the [[Video Graphics Array
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: VGA]] standard for its [[IBM PS/2]] computers.<ref name=\"pcmag\">{{Cite magazine
column6: title=Triple standard: three new video modes from IBM
column11: url-status=live}}</ref> Its use on [[IBM PC compatible]]s was widespread through the 1990s and persists today for some applications on modern computers.<ref name=\"solaris\">{{Cite web
column13: title=Appendix D: Console Frame Buffer Drivers
column16: quote=On x86 platforms, the Solaris kernel terminal emulator module (tem) uses VGA text mode exclusively to interact with the vgatext module. The vgatext module uses industry standard VGA text mode to interact with x86 compatible frame buffer devices.}}</ref> The main features of VGA text mode are colored (programmable 16 color [[palette (computing)
column17: palette]]) characters and their background, blinking, various shapes of the [[cursor (computers)
column20: title=Hardware Level VGA and SVGA Video Programming Information Page
column23: quote=The corresponding byte in plane 1 is used to specify the attributes of the character possibly including color, font select, blink, underline and reverse.
column24: accessdate=2020-04-13}}</ref> and loadable fonts (with various glyph sizes).<ref name=\"pcmag tutor\">{{Cite magazine
column34: quote=Unlike IBM's original video adapters, the CGA and the MDA, which store character bitmaps in ROM where they can't be altered, the EGA and the VGA store them in RAM.}}</ref> The [[Linux console]] traditionally uses hardware VGA text modes,<ref name=\"fbcon.txt\">{{cite web
column38: quote=If fbcon is detached from the console layer, your boot console driver (which is usually VGA text mode) will take over.}}</ref> and the [[Win32 console]] environment has an ability to switch the screen to text mode for some text window sizes.

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: border=\"0\" style=\"float:right; background:#005; color:white; font-size:small; width:50%;\"

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Distinctive features of VGA text as it commonly used:
Each screen character is represented by two [[octet (computing)
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: bytes]] aligned as a 16-bit word accessible by the CPU in a single operation. The lower, or character, byte is the actual code point for the current character set, and the higher, or attribute, byte is a [[bit field]] used to select various video attributes such as color, blinking, character set, and so forth.<ref name=\"vgatext\">{{cite web
column4: title=VGA/SVGA Video Programming-VGA Text Mode Operation
column7: accessdate=2016-11-07}}</ref> This byte-pair scheme is among the features that the VGA inherited from the [[Enhanced Graphics Adapter
column9: CGA]], and ultimately from the [[Monochrome Display Adapter

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: text_buffer_1}} Depending on the mode setup, attribute bit 7 may be either the blink bit or the fourth background color bit (which allows all 16 colors to be used as background colours).
text_buffer_2}} Attribute bit 3 (foreground intensity) also selects between fonts A and B (see [[#Fonts
column3: below]]). Therefore, if these fonts are not the same, this bit is simultaneously an additional code point bit.

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: text_buffer_3}} Attribute bit 0 also enables underline, if certain other attribute bits are set to zero (see [[#Underline

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Colors are assigned in the same way as in 4-bit indexed color graphic modes (see [[Video Graphics Array#Color palette

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: MDA features}}VGA modes have no need for the MDA's reverse and bright attributes because foreground and background colors can be set explicitly.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The VGA hardware has the ability to enable an [[underline]] on any character that has attribute bit 0 set. However, since this is an MDA-compatible feature,<ref name=\"mda\">{{cite web
column6: accessdate=2016-11-07}}</ref> the attribute bits not used by the MDA must be set to zero or the underline will not be shown.<ref name=\"vgatext\"/> This means that only bits 3 (intensity) and 7 (blink) can be set concurrently with bit 0 (underline). With the default VGA palette, setting bit 0 to enable underline will also change the text colour to blue. This means text in only two colors can be underlined (5555FF and 0000AA with the default palette).

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Despite all this, the underline is not normally visible in color modes, as the location of the underline defaults to a scanline below the character glyph, rendering it invisible.<ref name=\"vgatext\"/> If the underline location is set to a visible scanline (as it is by default when switching to an MDA-compatible monochrome text mode), then the underline will appear.

column4: [[Norton Utilities]] 6.01, an example of advanced [[text user interface
column5: TUI]] which redefines the character set to show tiny graphical [[GUI widget
column7: icon]]s and an arrow pointer in text mode.]]

column5: VGA shows us the [[code page 737]] with Greek letters]]

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Screen fonts used in EGA and VGA are [[monospace font
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: monospace]] [[raster font]]s containing 256 glyphs. All glyphs in a font are the same size, but this size can be changed. Typically, glyphs are 8 dots wide and 8–16 dots high, however the height can be any value up to a maximum of 32. Each row of a glyph is coded in an [[octet (computing)
column3: 8 bit byte]], with high bits to the left of the glyph and low bits to the right. Along with several hardware-dependent fonts stored in the adapter's [[Read-only memory
column4: ROM]], the text mode offers 8<ref name=\"vgatext\"/> loadable fonts. Two active font pointers (font A and font B) select two of the available fonts, although they usually point to the same font. When they each point to different fonts, attribute bit 3 (see [[#Text buffer
column5: above]]) acts as a font selection bit instead of as a foreground color bit. On real VGA hardware, this overrides the bit's use for color selection, but on many clones and emulators, the color selection remains — meaning one font is displayed as normal intensity, and the other as high-intensity. This error can be overcome by changing the palette registers to contain two copies of an 8-color palette.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: There are modes with a character box width of 9 dots (e.g. the default 80×25 mode), however the 9th column is used for spacing between characters, so the content cannot be changed. It is always blank, and drawn with the current background colour.<ref name=\"vgatext\"/> An exception to this is in ''Line Graphics Enable'' mode, which causes code points [[Hexadecimal
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: 0x]]C0 to 0xDF inclusive<ref name=\"vgatext\"/> to have the 8th column repeated as the 9th. These code points cover those [[box drawing characters]] which must extend all the way to the right side of the glyph box. For this reason, placing letter-like characters in code points 0xC0–0xDF should be avoided. The box drawing characters from 0xB0 to 0xBF are not extended, as they do not point to the right and so do not require extending.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The shape of the cursor is restricted to a [[rectangle]] the full width of the character box, and [[flood fill
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: filled]] with the foreground color of the character at the cursor's current location. Its height and position may be arbitrary within a character box;.<ref name=\"textcur\">{{cite web
column4: title=VGA/SVGA Video Programming-Manipulating the Text-mode Cursor
column7: accessdate=2016-11-07}}</ref> The EGA and many VGA clones allowed a split-box cursor (appearing as two rectangles, one at the top of the character box and one at the bottom), by setting the end of the cursor before the start, however if this is done on the original VGA, the cursor is completely hidden instead.<ref name=\"textcur\"/> The VGA standard does not provide a way to alter the blink rate,<ref name=\"textcur\"/> although common workarounds involve hiding the cursor and using a normal character glyph to provide a so-called software cursor.

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: mouse]] cursor in TUI (when implemented) is not usually the same thing as a hardware cursor, but a moving rectangle with altered background or a special glyph.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Some text-based interfaces, such as that of [[Impulse Tracker]], went to even greater lengths to provide a smoother and more graphic-looking mouse cursor. This was done by constantly re-generating character glyphs in real-time according to the cursor's on-screen position and the underlying characters.{{citation needed
There are generally two ways to access VGA text-mode for an application: through the [[Video BIOS]] interface or by directly accessing video [[random access memory
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: RAM]]<ref name=\"pcmag tutor\" /> and I/O ports. The latter method is considerably faster, and allows quick reading of the text buffer, for which reason it is preferred for advanced TUI programs.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The VGA text buffer is located at physical memory address 0xB8000.<ref name=\"cyrix\">{{Cite web
column7: date=1998-01-16}}</ref> Since this is usually used by [[16-bit]] [[x86]] processes operating in real-mode, it is the first half of memory [[x86 memory segmentation
column8: segment]] 0xB800. The text buffer data can be read and written, and [[bitwise operation]]s can be applied. A part of text buffer memory above the scope of the current mode is accessible, but is not shown.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The same physical addresses are used in [[protected mode]]. Applications may either have this part of memory mapped to their [[address space]] or access it via the [[operating system]]. When an application (on a modern [[computer multitasking
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: multitasking]] OS) does not have control over the [[system console
column3: console]], it accesses a part of system RAM instead of the actual text buffer.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: For computers in the 1980s, very fast manipulation <!-- there were some difficulties when same memory was accessed simultaneously by CPU and character generator, but I can’t remember details --> of the text buffer, with the hardware generating the individual pixels as fast as they could be displayed, was extremely useful for a fast UI. Even on relatively modern hardware, the [[computational overhead
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: overhead]] of text mode emulation via hardware [[All Points Addressable
column3: APA]] (graphics) modes (in which the program generates individual pixels and stores them into the video buffer) may be noticeable.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: From the monitor's side, there is no difference in input signal in a text mode and an [[All Points Addressable
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: APA]] mode of the same size. A text mode signal may have the same [[video signal timing
column3: timings]] as [[VESA]] standard modes. The same registers are used on adapter's side to set up these parameters in a text mode as in APA modes. The text mode output signal is essentially the same as in graphic modes, but its source is a text buffer and character generator, not a [[framebuffer]] as in APA.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Depending on the graphics adapter used, a variety of text modes are available on [[IBM PC compatible]] computers. They are listed on the table below:<ref name=\"PC Mag\">{{cite book
column4: title=VGA Compatibles: Gaining on the New Standard

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: VGA and compatible cards support MDA, CGA and EGA modes. All colored modes have the same design of text attributes. MDA modes have some specific features (see [[#MDA features
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: above]]) — a text could be emphasized with bright, underline, reverse and blinking attributes.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The most common text mode used in DOS environments and initial Windows consoles is the default 80 columns by 25 rows, or 80×25, with 16 colors and 8×16 pixels large characters. VGA cards always have a built-in font of this size whereas other sizes may require downloading a differently sized font.<ref name=\"openbsd\">{{Cite web
column5: quote=16 different colors can be displayed at the same time. Characters are 8×16 pixels large, and a font consists of 256 characters. A built-in font of this size is always present on a VGA card.}}</ref> This mode was available on practically all [[IBM]] and compatible personal computers.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Two other VGA text modes, 80×40 and 80×50, exist but are less common. [[Windows NT 4.0]] displayed its system messages during the boot process in 80×50 text mode.<ref>{{Cite book
column4: title=Windows XP Registry: A Complete Guide to Customizing and Optimizing Windows XP
column5: quote=On obvious difference between Windows 2000/XP and Windows NT 4.0 is the fact that all system messages that appear during the Windows NT 4.0 boot process are displayed in 80×50 text mode, while Windows 2000 and Windows XP display these messages in VGA mode.}}</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Character sizes and graphical resolutions for the extended [[VESA BIOS Extensions
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: VESA]]-compatible [[Super VGA]] text modes are manufacturer's dependent. Some cards (e.g. [[S3 Graphics
column3: S3]]) supported custom very large text modes, like 132×43 and 132×25.<ref name=\"S3 manual\">{{Cite web
column9: quote=The S3 ViRGE supports 132×43 and 132×25 extended text modes for text applications. This also allows you to emulate terminals requiring 132 columns of text.}}</ref> Like as in graphic modes, graphic adapters of 2000s commonly are capable to set up an arbitrarily-sized text mode (in reasonable limits) instead of choosing its parameters from some list.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: On [[Linux]] and DOS systems with so named SVGA cards, a program called SVGATextMode<ref>{{Cite web
column8: quote=SVGATextMode uses extra features on SVGA cards to enhance Linux textmodes. It allows setting of the pixel clock, H/V timings, font size, cursor size, etc, and lets you use your video card and monitor to their full potential in textmode.}}</ref> can be used to set up better looking text modes than EGA and VGA standard ones. This is particularly useful for [[Computer monitor#Screen size
column9: large]] (≥ 17\") monitors, where the normal 80×25 VGA text mode's 720×400 pixel resolution is far lower than a typical graphics mode would be. SVGATextMode allows setting of the [[pixel clock]] and higher [[refresh rate]], larger font size, cursor size, etc., and allows a better use of the potential of a video card and monitor. In non-Windows systems, the use of SVGATextMode (or alternative options such as the [[Linux framebuffer]]) to obtain a sharp text is critical for [[LCD monitor]]s of [[1280×1024]] (or higher resolution) because none of so named standard text modes fits to this matrix size. SVGATextMode also allows a fine tuning of video signal timings.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Despite the name of this program, only a few of its supported modes conform to SVGA (i.e. VESA) standards.

VGA text mode has some hardware-imposed limitations. Because these are too restrictive for modern (post 2000) applications, the hardware text mode on VGA compatible video adapters only has a limited use.

column3: Not all hardware support glyphs narrower than 8 dots.

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring:
At least
''4,000''
(reached at 80×50)

column3: A modern adapter, if it supports non-standard modes, may produce a reasonably dense text screen even on a large monitor.

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring:

([[characters per line]])

(number of lines)

column3:
Code page size
(number of different glyphs displayed simultaneously)

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: * 8 colors may be used by font A and other 8 colors by font B; so, if font A ≠ font B (512 characters mode), then the palette should be halved and a text may effectively use only '''8''' colors.
<sup>**</sup> Normally, first 8 colors of the same palette. If blink is disabled, then all 16 colors are available for background.
[[Category:DOS on IBM PC compatibles]]","<noinclude>{{User:RMCD bot/subject notice
</noinclude>'''VGA text mode''' was introduced in 1987 by IBM as part of the [[Video Graphics Array
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: VGA]] standard for its [[IBM PS/2]] computers.<ref name=\"pcmag\">{{Cite magazine
column6: title=Triple standard: three new video modes from IBM
column11: url-status=live}}</ref> Its use on [[IBM PC compatible]]s was widespread through the 1990s and persists today for some applications on modern computers.<ref name=\"solaris\">{{Cite web
column13: title=Appendix D: Console Frame Buffer Drivers
column16: quote=On x86 platforms, the Solaris kernel terminal emulator module (tem) uses VGA text mode exclusively to interact with the vgatext module. The vgatext module uses industry standard VGA text mode to interact with x86 compatible frame buffer devices.}}</ref> The main features of VGA text mode are colored (programmable 16 color [[palette (computing)
column17: palette]]) characters and their background, blinking, various shapes of the [[cursor (computers)
column20: title=Hardware Level VGA and SVGA Video Programming Information Page
column23: quote=The corresponding byte in plane 1 is used to specify the attributes of the character possibly including color, font select, blink, underline and reverse.
column24: accessdate=2020-04-13}}</ref> and loadable fonts (with various glyph sizes).<ref name=\"pcmag tutor\">{{Cite magazine
column34: quote=Unlike IBM's original video adapters, the CGA and the MDA, which store character bitmaps in ROM where they can't be altered, the EGA and the VGA store them in RAM.}}</ref> The [[Linux console]] traditionally uses hardware VGA-compatible text modes,<ref name=\"fbcon.txt\">{{cite web
column38: quote=If fbcon is detached from the console layer, your boot console driver (which is usually VGA text mode) will take over.}}</ref> and the [[Win32 console]] environment has an ability to switch the screen to text mode for some text window sizes.

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: border=\"0\" style=\"float:right; background:#005; color:white; font-size:small; width:50%;\"

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Distinctive features of VGA text as it commonly used:
Each screen character is represented by two [[octet (computing)
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: bytes]] aligned as a 16-bit word accessible by the CPU in a single operation. The lower, or character, byte is the actual code point for the current character set, and the higher, or attribute, byte is a [[bit field]] used to select various video attributes such as color, blinking, character set, and so forth.<ref name=\"vgatext\">{{cite web
column4: title=VGA/SVGA Video Programming-VGA Text Mode Operation
column7: accessdate=2016-11-07}}</ref> This byte-pair scheme is among the features that the VGA inherited from the [[Enhanced Graphics Adapter
column9: CGA]], and ultimately from the [[Monochrome Display Adapter

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: text_buffer_1}} Depending on the mode setup, attribute bit 7 may be either the blink bit or the fourth background color bit (which allows all 16 colors to be used as background colours).
text_buffer_2}} Attribute bit 3 (foreground intensity) also selects between fonts A and B (see [[#Fonts
column3: below]]). Therefore, if these fonts are not the same, this bit is simultaneously an additional code point bit.

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: text_buffer_3}} Attribute bit 0 also enables underline, if certain other attribute bits are set to zero (see [[#Underline

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Colors are assigned in the same way as in 4-bit indexed color graphic modes (see [[Video Graphics Array#Color palette

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: MDA features}}VGA modes have no need for the MDA's reverse and bright attributes because foreground and background colors can be set explicitly.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The VGA hardware has the ability to enable an [[underline]] on any character that has attribute bit 0 set. However, since this is an MDA-compatible feature,<ref name=\"mda\">{{cite web
column6: accessdate=2016-11-07}}</ref> the attribute bits not used by the MDA must be set to zero or the underline will not be shown.<ref name=\"vgatext\"/> This means that only bits 3 (intensity) and 7 (blink) can be set concurrently with bit 0 (underline). With the default VGA palette, setting bit 0 to enable underline will also change the text colour to blue. This means text in only two colors can be underlined (5555FF and 0000AA with the default palette).

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Despite all this, the underline is not normally visible in color modes, as the location of the underline defaults to a scanline below the character glyph, rendering it invisible.<ref name=\"vgatext\"/> If the underline location is set to a visible scanline (as it is by default when switching to an MDA-compatible monochrome text mode), then the underline will appear.

column7: icon]]s and an arrow pointer in text mode.]]

→‎Books:Cleanup andtypo fixing,typo(s) fixed: edidtions → editions,safe,Iridescent,"{{Infobox person
'''Stanisław Marian Waltoś''' (born 9 February 1932) is a Polish [[Jurisprudence
column3: academic]] specializing in [[criminal law]] and [[legal history]], [[professor]] of legal sciences, member of the [[Polish Academy of Sciences]] and the [[Polish Academy of Learning]], professor of the [[Jagiellonian University]], who was Head of the Criminal Proceedings Department at the Faculty of Law of the Jagiellonian University from 1974, as well as the director of the [[Collegium Maius, Kraków

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In the 1990s he was an expert of the [[Council of Europe]] and the [[Government of Latvia
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: government of the Republic of Latvia]]. In 1987–1995 he was a member of the Commission for the Reform of Criminal Law in Poland. He participated in the work on Polish criminal codifications of 1997. He was the initiator of the introduction to the Polish criminal procedure of an anonymous witness and a [[turn state's evidence]]. In 2000–2002 he was a member of the Legislative Council by the [[Prime Minister of Poland]].

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: He authored about 400 academic papers and other works, including the regularly updated and re-issued academic textbook ''Criminal Trial: The System Outline'' (''Proces karny: zarys systemu''). Between 1985–2002 he was the editor-in-chief of the journals ''Archivum Iuridicum Cracoviense'' and ''Opuscula Muzealia'' (he became the editor-in-chief of the latter again in 2006). In 2006 he was chosen the chairman of the Scientific Council of the [[Ossolineum

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Stanisławów]], the son of Elma Cecylia née Buszyńska and Tadeusz Waltoś.<ref name=\"kierownicy\">{{citeweb
column7: author=Marcin Andrzejewski}}</ref> His younger brother Jacek Waltoś was born in 1938,<ref name=\"forum\">{{citejournal
column15: accessdate=17 March 2020}}</ref> and later became a painter known for his activity within Grupa Wprost.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Stanisław Waltoś attended the elementary school in [[Jasło]] until sixth grade. From 1946, he attended the Władysław Jagiełło High School in [[Dębica]], where in 1950 he passed the [[Matura
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: matriculation examination]] with distinction.<ref name=\"kierownicy\" /> While in school, he was a member of the [[Polish Scouting and Guiding Association
column3: Polish Scouting Association]], and was the commander of the scouts' poviat command in Dębica.<ref name=\"kierownicy\" />

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In 1954 he graduated in law from the [[Jagiellonian University]].<ref name=\"ln\">{{cite web
column3: title = Stanisław Waltoś w bazie Ludzi nauki
column8: title = Rozmowa z prof. Stanisławem Waltosiem
column13: title = Prof. Stanisław Waltoś profesorem honorowym UJ
column16: accessdate = 14 March 2020}}</ref> Marian Cieślak and Władysław Wolter as his „great masters”,<ref name=\"profesorhonorowy\" /> that had decisive influence on his formation as a legal scholar.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: After completing his studies, he was prescripted to work at the [[Prosecutor#Poland

He was offered a position at the university by Marian Cieślak, who read his critical article on the penal code draft modeled on the Stalinist code.<ref name=\"kierownicy\" />

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In 1962 he obtained a [[Doctor of Philosophy
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Ph.D.]] upon the dissertation ''Functions and forms of the indictment in a criminal trial'', supervised by Marian Cieślak and subsequently awarded by the journal ''Państwo i Prawo''. Between 1962–1964 he was a counselor at the District Prosecutor's Office in Kraków. In 1964 he received a habilitation scholarship and resigned from the work at the prosecutor's office.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In 1968 he obtained [[habilitation]] upon the work ''A model of preparatory proceedings against a comparative law background''.<ref name=\"edukacja\">{{citejournal

column5: date=April 2001}}</ref> In 1974, he was appointed the Head of the Criminal Proceedings Department at the Faculty of Law of the Jagiellonian University. ,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: He published as author, co-author or editor about four hundred [[Academic publishing#Scholarly paper

These include the academic textbook ''Criminal Trial: The System Outline'' (''Proces karny: zarys systemu''), that has been resumed and updated several times. His research interests over the years have included: [[Procedural law
column3: procedural rules]], organization of the prosecutor's office, preparatory proceedings model, [[Evidence (law)
column4: evidence]] issues (including the institution of the [[turn state's evidence]] and incognito [[witness]]), the Anglo-Saxon principle of the [[fruit of the poisonous tree]], as well as various aspects of the course of the trial, such as [[Consensus decision-making
column5: consensualism]], analysis of the rights of participants in the proceedings against the background of the constitutional standard, [[press laws]], special proceedings, issues of the validation of procedural acts, pragmatism and anti-pragmatism in criminal proceedings, procedural obstruction, i.e. abuse of law, excessive length of proceedings.<ref name=\"kierownicy\" />

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: He collaborated on publications including with Kazimierz Buchała, Marian Cieślak and Andrzej Marek. In September 2004, he was awarded the Kraków Book of the Month Award for the book ''Na tropach doktora Fausta i inne szkice '' (''On the Traces of Dr. Faust and Other Sketches'').

He promoted three hundred and seventy master's theses and seventeen doctoral dissertations. A number of his doctoral students subsequently became specialists in law and criminal proceedings, including: Barbara Nita-Światłowska, Andrzej Światłowski, Dobrosław Szumało-Kulczyk and Antoni Bojańczyk.

Stanisław Waltoś was elected a correspondent member (2002) and then a real member (2007) of the [[Polish Academy of Sciences]].<ref name=\"pan\" /> He became a correspondent member (1996) and an active member (2008) of the [[Polish Academy of Learning]].<ref name=\"pan\" /><ref name=\"kierownicy\" /><ref name=\"edukacja\" /> In 2001, he was elected a correspondent member of Nordrhein-Westphälische Akademie der Wissenschaften. He was the vice-chairman (1992–2002) and the chairman (2003–2007) of the Legal Sciences Committee of the Polish Academy of Sciences, the vice-chairman of the 'Poland in United Europe' Committee at the Presidium of the Polish Academy of Sciences (2002–2006), a member of the Presidium of the Polish Academy of Sciences in Kraków (2002–2010). '''Stanisław Marian Waltoś''' (born 9 February 1932) is a Polish [[Jurisprudence
column3: academic]] specializing in [[criminal law]] and [[legal history]], [[professor]] of legal sciences, member of the [[Polish Academy of Sciences]] and the [[Polish Academy of Learning]], professor of the [[Jagiellonian University]], who was Head of the Criminal Proceedings Department at the Faculty of Law of the Jagiellonian University from 1974, as well as the director of the [[Collegium Maius, Kraków

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: government of the Republic of Latvia]]. In 1987–1995 he was a member of the Commission for the Reform of Criminal Law in Poland. He participated in the work on Polish criminal codifications of 1997. He was the initiator of the introduction to the Polish criminal procedure of an anonymous witness and a [[turn state's evidence]]. In 2000–2002 he was a member of the Legislative Council by the [[Prime Minister of Poland]].

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: He authored about 400 academic papers and other works, including the regularly updated and re-issued academic textbook ''Criminal Trial: The System Outline'' (''Proces karny: zarys systemu''). column37: title=Selena Gomez's Road to 'Rare': How Pop's Quietest Singer Began to Raise Her Voice
column42: quote=\"Look at Her Now\" is one of Julia Michaels and Gomez’s quirkiest concoctions, an offbeat dance-pop track with autobiographical lyrics [...]}}</ref>), and [[electropop]]<ref>{{cite web
column45: title=Album Review: Selena Gomez's 'Rare' Is A Pop Revelation
column50: quote=The fact that the songs bookend the same narrative, yet sound completely different (one is a piano ballad [\"Lose You to Love Me\"], the other an electro-pop banger [\"Look at Her Now\"]) [...]}}</ref> song. The song entered the top 20 on charts in Canada, the Czech Republic, Greece, Estonia, Hungary, Ireland, Malaysia, Norway, Singapore, Slovakia and Switzerland; as well as the top 40 in the United States, Australia, Austria, New Zealand, Portugal and the United Kingdom. The song received positive reviews from [[Music journalism
column51: music critics]], with many praising its production and the self-confidence message Gomez portrays throughout the song.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Madeline Roth from ''[[MTV News]]'' called the track a \"fresh tune\", and an \"upbeat, danceable track that unabashedly celebrates her post-heartbreak bounce-back\". Roth also wrote that the song was \"her way of assuring fans, and herself, that she's moving on in stunning fashion\".<ref>{{cite web
column4: title=Selena Gomez Dances Through Her Heartbreak In The Surprise 'Look At Her Now' Video
column7: accessdate=17 November 2019}}</ref> Writing for ''[[Entertainment Tonight]]'', Zach Seemayer found that the lyrics \"explores the confidence that can be regained when you find yourself after a split\".<ref>{{Cite web
column9: title=Selena Gomez Surprises Fans With Bold New Song 'Look At Her Now'
column18: access-date=17 November 2019}}</ref> In an article for ''[[Rolling Stone]]'', Brittany Spanos described the song as an \"upbeat, club-primed song\" that \"sounds like a part two to \"Lose You to Love Me\"\".<ref>{{Cite web
column20: title=Selena Gomez Knows She Will Find Love in 'Look at Her Now' Video
column29: access-date=17 November 2019}}</ref> Chris Murphy, in an article by [[Vulture magazine
column30: ''Vulture'']], saw Gomez as an \"incredibly famous girl singing in the third person about getting over her incredibly famous ex-boyfriend\". While quoting lyrics from the song, Murphy wrote that Gomez \"has entered a new phase of her life. She’s now Selena 2.0\".<ref>{{Cite web
column32: title=Selena Gomez Doesn't Even Necessarily Want Love in Surprise 'Look at Her Now' Video
column40: access-date=17 November 2019}}</ref> Lake Schatz from ''[[Consequence of Sound]]'' felt that the track \"encourages self-love and perseverance\".<ref>{{Cite web
column42: title=Selena Gomez perseveres on new song \"Look at Her Now\": Stream
column52: Elle]]'' wrote that the song was a \"far more splashy take on a boy cheating on her\".<ref>{{Cite web
column54: title=Selena Gomez's 'Look at Her Now' Lyrics Are a Kiss-Off to Justin Bieber and the Relationship He Broke
column64: Idolator]]'' wrote that Gomez \"sings over simmering beats\" while she \"celebrates her perseverance after a devastating breakup\". Nied also called the chorus \"instantly hummable\" and that it was \"an absolute earworm that is bound to dominate radio for months to come\".<ref>{{Cite web
column66: title=Another New Song! Selena Gomez Drops \"Look At Her Now\"
column75: Paper Magazine]]'', Michael Love Michael described the track as \"confident\" and that it was a \"club-ready refresh, with an infectious 'mmm' chorus\", and described the beat as \"bouncy and \"minimal\".<ref>{{Cite web
column77: title=Bops Only: 10 Songs You Need to Start Your Weekend Right
column86: access-date=19 November 2019}}</ref> Tino Kolokathis from ''[[Elite Daily]]'' wrote that the chorus \"gives fans major techno vibes\", and called the song as a whole \"empowering\", and also wrote that the lyrics of the track \"will have you saying, 'Yaaaas, girl!'\".<ref>{{Cite web
column88: title=Selena Gomez Dropped A Surprise Second Song & The Lyrics Are So Empowering

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The music video, which was released the same day as the song, features Gomez and background dancers, dancing in a very colorful tent. Like the \"[[Lose You to Love Me]]\" music video, it was also fully shot on an [[iPhone 11 Pro]], and was also directed by [[Sophie Muller]].<ref>{{cite web
column3: title=Selena Gomez \"Look at Her Now\" (Sophie Muller, dir.)
column5: accessdate=November 4, 2019}}</ref> The video's aesthetic was inspired by early 2000s pop and R&B, it specifically references music videos by [[Aaliyah]], [[Britney Spears]] and [[Missy Elliott]].<ref>{{Cite web
column7: title=Selena Gomez Reveals Inspiration For 'Look At Her Now' Visual in New Pop-Up Video: Watch

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The song, along with \"[[Lose You to Love Me]]\" was first performed at the [[American Music Awards of 2019
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: 2019 American Music Awards]] as the opening number on November 24, 2019.<ref>{{Cite web
column4: title=How to Watch the 2019 American Music Awards on TV and Online

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: After one day of tracking, the song debuted at number three on the US [[Bubbling Under Hot 100
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: ''Billboard'' Bubbling Under Hot 100 Singles]] chart, and entered the US [[Billboard Hot 100
column3: ''Billboard'' Hot 100]] at number 27 a week after. That same week, the song debuted at number 26 in the UK and number 29 in Australia. The song entered the top 20 on charts in Canada, Ireland, Norway, Singapore, and Switzerland. It also debuted in the top 10 of Greece, Latvia and Slovakia.

column4: title=Look At Her Now by Selena Gomez

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: [[Category:Songs written by Selena Gomez]]",Look at Her Now,//en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Look_at_Her_Now
'''Hurtigruten''' (\"Express Route\", formally The coastal route Bergen-Kirkenes) is a [[Norway
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Norwegian]] public coastal route transporting passengers that travel locally, regionally and between the ports of call, and also cargo between ports north of [[Tromsø]].<ref>{{cite web

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Hurtigruten provides daily, year-round and consistent traffic between [[Bergen]] and [[Kirkenes]] with 34 ports of call on northbound and 33 ports of call on southbound sailings. The Ministry of Transport and Communications in Norway has set minimum capacity requirements of 320 passengers, 120 berths and cargo for 150 Euro-pallets. The current agreement with the privately held company [[Hurtigruten AS]] entered into force on 1 January 2012 and expired on 31 December 2019, with an optional 1-year extension. From 2021 the two companies Hurtigruten AS and [[Havila Kystruten]] AS will operate the route.<ref>{{cite web

column6: 2}} near [[Bodø]] on her first round-trip in 1893.]]

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: text=under what name?}} by government contract to improve communications along Norway's long, jagged coastline. {{SS
column5: 2}} began the first round-trip journey from Trondheim on 2 July 1893 bound for [[Hammerfest (town)
column6: Hammerfest]], with calls at [[Rørvik]], [[Brønnøy]], [[Sandnessjøen]], [[Bodø]], [[Svolvær]], [[Lødingen]], [[Harstad]], [[Tromsø]] and [[Skjervøy]]. The ship arrived at Svolvær on Monday 3 July at 8pm after 35½ hours and at Hammerfest on Wednesday 5 July after 67 hours. She was commanded by Hurtigruten founder [[Richard With]]. As of 2008, the Trondheim–Svolvær trip took 33 hours and the Trondheim–Hammerfest trip took 41 hours 15 min.{{Citation needed

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Before Hurtigruten opened, only [[Vesteraalens Dampskibsselskab]] was willing to make the trip through the then poorly-charted waters; the voyage was especially difficult during the long, dark winters. Hurtigruten was a substantial breakthrough for communities along its path. Mail from central Norway to Hammerfest, which used to take three weeks in summer and five months in winter, could now be delivered in seven days.{{Citation needed

column5: ''Narvik'']] in [[Svolvær]]. The ship was sold in 2007.]]

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Encouraged by Vesteraalens' early success, several other shipping companies obtained a concession to operate the route, extended to run between Bergen in the southwest and Kirkenes in the far northeast. A fleet of 11 ships visits each of the 34 ports daily, both northbound and southbound.{{Citation needed

Until the 1940s most ports north of Trondheim could not be reached by road from Oslo, so the sea was the only means of access. Beginning in the 1960s, the role of Hurtigruten changed, in part because of the construction of a local airport network and road improvements. Operating subsidies were gradually phased out, and the operators put more emphasis on tourism. New, bigger and more luxurious ships were introduced in the 1980s, with attention given to hot tubs, bars, restaurants and other comforts. However, Hurtigruten still serves important passenger and cargo needs, and operates 365 days a year. The last two independent shipping companies, [[Ofotens og Vesteraalens Dampskibsselskab]] (OVDS) and [[Troms Fylkes Dampskibsselskap]] (TFDS), merged on 1 March 2006 as the [[Hurtigruten Group]], a year later becoming Hurtigruten ASA. In 2015 Hurtigruten was delisted from the Oslo stock exchange after the company was acquired by the private equity group [[TDR Capital]].<ref>{{cite web
column7: title=Cruise Operator Hurtigruten Said to Attract Private Equity Firms
column13: accessdate=28 March 2017}}</ref> In addition to the voyages in Norway, the company operates expedition cruises to Greenland, Canada, South America, Iceland, Svalbard and Antarctica.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The Ministry of Transport and Communications in Norway announced in 2017 that the Hurtigruten contract was split into three contracts. The contracts were put up for bid and in the end, two were granted to Hurtigruten AS and one to Havila Kystruten AS, with each operating seven and four ships respectively. The two companies will alternate departure days for the entire route from Bergen to Kirkenes.<ref name=\":0\">{{cite web
Havila Kystruten AS is building four new vessels to serve the route, while Hurtigruten AS will be refitting seven of its vessels to meet the stricter emissions requirements.<ref name=\":0\" />
The four new vessels from Havila will run on LNG and battery power. LNG will cut CO₂ emissions by 25 per cent, and the battery power will yield additional savings.<ref>{{cite web
column6: access-date=2019-10-17}}</ref> The vessels will be named Havila Capella, Havila Castor, Havila Polaris and Havila Pollux. All four vessels is under construction at Tersan shipyard in Turkey.<ref>{{Cite web
column8: title=Tersan Shipyard to build two ships for Havila Kystruten

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Existing vessels from Hurtigruten will be modernized and renovated in order to meet the new requirements.<ref name=\":0\" /> [[MS Midnatsol (2002)
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: MS Eirik Raude]], [[MS Trollfjord]] and [[MS Finnmarken (2002)
column3: MS Otto Sverdrup]] are all getting modernized and renovated with a scandinavian interior style similar to the expedition vessels [[MS Roald Amundsen]] and [[MS Fridtjof Nansen]].{{Citation needed

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The ships will be fitted with filters and LNG compatible engines in order to reduce emissions by 25%. The ships will also get hybrid motors, and battery packs.{{Citation needed

column7: Hammerfest]] in June 2005, displaying the TFDS funnel colours.]]

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Slow television#2011: Hurtigruten – minutt for minutt}}

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: As part of its [[slow television]] series, the [[Norwegian Broadcasting Corporation]] transmitted non-stop the Hurtigruten ship {{MS
column4: 6}}'s 134-hour voyage from [[Bergen]] to [[Kirkenes]], which started on June 16, 2011.<ref name=\"NRK Beta\">{{cite web
column7: title=Hurtigruten: 5 day TV marathon in the midnight sun

column3: Memorial in [[Bodø]] commemorating the incident on board ''Erling Jarl'' in 1958. Total height: 2,3 meters. Sculptor: [[Istvan Lisztes]].]]

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Before World War II, a number of ships perished, usually because they ran aground in bad visibility.
Most of the Hurtigruten fleet was sunk during World War II.

column4: 6}} ran aground in [[Raftsundet]] at night. The ship started taking on water and sank. Five persons died. There were 157 passengers and a crew of 46 on board.<ref>{{cite web

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: On January 8, 1958, a fire broke out on board MS ''Erling Jarl'' while the vessel was docked at [[Bodø]]. Due to the thick smoke 14 people died of smoke inhalation. Today a memorial to the incident stands at Bodø.<ref>{{cite web
On October 21, 1962 MS ''Sanct Svithun'' ran onto a reef in the maritime area [[Folda, Nord-Trøndelag
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Folda]] in [[Nord-Trøndelag]] because of a major navigational error after leaving [[Trondheim]]. Of 89 persons on board (passengers, crew and two postal officers) 41 died.<ref>{{cite web

column4: 6}} suffered an engine room fire, leading to two deaths among the crew.<ref>{{cite web

Havila Kystruten AS is building four new vessels to serve the route, while Hurtigruten AS will be refitting seven of its vessels to meet the stricter emissions requirements.<ref name=\":0\" />
The four new vessels from Havila will run on LNG and battery power. LNG will cut CO₂ emissions by 25 per cent, and the battery power will yield additional savings.<ref>{{cite web
column6: access-date=2019-10-17}}</ref> The vessels will be named Havila Capella, Havila Castor, Havila Polaris and Havila Pollux. All four vessels is under construction at Tersan shipyard in Turkey.<ref>{{Cite web
column8: title=Tersan Shipyard to build two ships for Havila Kystruten

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Existing vessels from Hurtigruten will be modernized and renovated in order to meet the new requirements.<ref name=\":0\" /> [[MS Midnatsol (2002)
column3: MS Finnmarken]] are all getting modernized and renovated with a scandinavian interior style similar to the new [[MS Roald Amundsen]] and [[MS Fridtjof Nansen]].{{Citation needed

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The ships will be fitted with filters and LNG compatible engines in order to reduce emissions by 25%. The ships will also get hybrid motors, and battery packs.{{Citation needed

column7: Hammerfest]] in June 2005, displaying the TFDS funnel colours.]]

column4: 6}} ran aground in [[Raftsundet]] at night. The ship started taking on water and sank. Five persons died. There were 157 passengers and a crew of 46 on board.<ref>{{cite web

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: On January 8, 1958, a fire broke out on board MS ''Erling Jarl'' while the vessel was docked at [[Bodø]]. Due to the thick smoke 14 people died of smoke inhalation. Today a memorial to the incident stands at Bodø.<ref>{{cite web
On October 21, 1962 MS ''Sanct Svithun'' ran onto a reef in the maritime area [[Folda, Nord-Trøndelag
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Folda]] in [[Nord-Trøndelag]] because of a major navigational error after leaving [[Trondheim]]. Of 89 persons on board (passengers, crew and two postal officers) 41 died.<ref>{{cite web

column4: 6}} suffered an engine room fire, leading to two deaths among the crew.<ref>{{cite web

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: '''Kendall Christopher Fuller''' (born February 13, 1995) is an [[American football]] [[cornerback]] for the [[Washington Redskins]] of the [[National Football League]] (NFL). Fuller played his college football at [[Virginia Tech Hokies football
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Virginia Tech]], and was drafted by the Redskins in the third round in the [[2016 NFL Draft]]. He also played for the [[Kansas City Chiefs]], where he was included as part of the trade for quarterback [[Alex Smith]] in 2018. He won a [[Super Bowl]] as a member of the Chiefs in 2019, recording an interception in their [[Super Bowl LIV]] victory.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Fuller attended [[Our Lady of Good Counsel High School (Montgomery County, Maryland)
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Our Lady of Good Counsel High School]] in [[Olney, Maryland]], where he played football and ran track. On the football varsity, he was teammates with [[Blake Countess]] and [[Stefon Diggs]]. As a senior, he was the U.S. Army All-American Defensive Player of the Year and the Maryland [[Gatorade Football Player of the Year]] after he totaled 44 receptions for 695 yards and seven [[touchdowns]] on offense, and three interceptions, eight pass breakups and 28 tackles (including a sack) on defense.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In [[track & field]], Fuller competed in hurdles and jumps, posting bests of 17.94 seconds in the [[110 metres hurdles
column3: 300m hurdles]], 6.48 meters (21 feet, 2.5 inches) in the [[long jump]] and 13.71m (45 feet) in the [[triple jump]].<ref>http://md.milesplit.com/athletes/1223543-kendall-fuller/feed#.VV4CjWiUdU1</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Fuller was a five-star recruit by [[Rivals.com]] and was ranked as the second best cornerback and ninth best player overall in his class.<ref>[https://sports.yahoo.com/footballrecruiting/football/recruiting/player-Kendall-Fuller-114365 Rivals.com]</ref> He committed to [[Virginia Tech]] in July 2012 to play [[college football]].<ref>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/hokies-journal/post/good-counsel-all-met-kendall-fuller-commits-to-virginia-tech/2012/07/29/gJQAlstZIX_blog.html Good Counsel All-Met Kendall Fuller commits to Virginia Tech]</ref><ref>[http://www.newsadvance.com/sports/kendall-fuller-commits-to-tech/article_e7f1a464-58b7-558a-a3b7-bee49dab43e6.html? Kendall Fuller commits to Tech]</ref>
As a true freshman in 2013, Fuller started 12 of 13 games, recording 58 tackles and six [[interceptions]]. For his play he was named the [[Atlantic Coast Conference
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: ACC]] Defensive Rookie of the Year.<ref>[http://www.hokiesports.com/football/recaps/20131203aaa.html Kendall Fuller earns ACC Defensive Rookie of the Year honors]</ref><ref>[http://articles.dailypress.com/2013-12-03/sports/dp-spt-tech-kendall-fuller-acc-defensive-rookie-of-20131203_1_kendall-fuller-brandon-facyson-acc-defensive-rookie Virginia Tech's Kendall Fuller earns ACC defensive rookie of the year honors]</ref> Fuller returned as a starter his sophomore season in 2014.<ref>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/colleges/hokies-cornerback-kendall-fuller-is-ready-to-build-on-his-stellar-freshman-season/2014/08/08/f735cd36-1efc-11e4-ae54-0cfe1f974f8a_story.html Hokies cornerback Kendall Fuller is ready to build on his stellar freshman season.]</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: On December 15, 2015, Fuller announced he would be declaring for the [[2016 NFL Draft]].<ref>Fortuna, Matt, [http://espn.go.com/nfl/draft2016/story/_/id/14375563/kendall-fuller-virginia-tech-hokies-declares-nfl-draft \"Virginia Tech CB Kendall Fuller declares for NFL draft\"], \"ESPN\", December 15, 2015</ref><ref>{{cite web

Fuller attended the [[NFL Scouting Combine]], but was unable to perform any physical drills due to a torn [[Meniscus (anatomy)
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: meniscus]] he suffered in the fall.<ref>{{cite web
column3: title=NFL draft: Redskins take Virginia Tech corner Kendall Fuller in the third round
column8: date=April 29, 2016}}</ref> Before his meniscus tear, Fuller was projected to be a first round pick by NFL draft experts and scouts. Fuller was ranked the fifth best cornerback prospect in the draft by DraftScout.com, the ninth best cornerback by NFL analyst [[Mike Mayock]], and was ranked the 10th best defensive back prospect by [[Sports Illustrated]].<ref>{{cite web
column9: title=*Kendall Fuller, DS #5 CB, Virginia Tech

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The [[Washington Redskins]] selected Fuller in the third round (84th overall) of the [[2016 NFL Draft]].<ref>{{cite web
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title=Redskins Add To Cornerbacks Group With Kendall Fuller
column7: accessdate=July 16, 2017}}</ref> Fuller was the 14th cornerback selected in 2016.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: On June 2, 2016, the Washington Redskins signed Fuller to a four-year, [[United States dollar
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: $]]3.12 million contract that includes a [[signing bonus]] of $718,424.<ref>{{cite web

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Throughout training camp, he competed against [[Quinton Dunbar]], [[Greg Toler]], and [[Dashaun Phillips]] to be the third cornerback on the Redskins' depth chart.<ref>{{cite web
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title=Quinton Dunbar returns to action after welcoming first child
column7: date=July 30, 2016}}</ref> Head coach [[Jay Gruden]] named Fuller the fifth cornerback on the depth chart to start the regular season, behind [[Josh Norman]], [[Bashaud Breeland]], Quinton Dunbar, and Greg Toler.<ref>{{cite web
column8: title=Redskins release first depth chart of 2016 season

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: He was inactive for the first three games (Weeks 1-3) and made his professional regular season debut in Week 4 after injuries to Bashaud Breeland and Quinton Dunbar.<ref>{{cite web
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title=After injuries, Kendall Fuller Getting Opportunity for Playing Time
column4: date=September 28, 2016}}</ref> On October 2, 2016, Fuller earned his first career start and recorded a season-high eight combined tackles during a 31–20 victory against the [[2016 Cleveland Browns season
column5: Cleveland Browns]]. Fuller surpassed Greg Toler on the depth chart after Week 7 and became their fourth cornerback. In Week 8, he tied his season-high of seven solo tackles in the Redskins' 27–37 tie at the [[2016 Cincinnati Bengals season
column10: website=NFL.com}}</ref> After struggling in Week 13, Fuller was replaced by Greg Toler after defensive coordinator [[Joe Barry]] demoted him to the fifth cornerback on the depth chart.<ref name=\"ESPN\">{{cite web
column11: title=Su'a Cravens, Kendall Fuller can provide big boost to Redskins' secondary
column16: date=June 28, 2017}}</ref> He finished his rookie season in {{NFL Year
column17: 2016}} with 42 combined tackles (32 solo) and two pass deflections in 13 games and six starts.<ref name=\"career\">{{cite web

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Fuller entered training camp slated as the starting nickelback, but saw competition from rookies [[Fabian Moreau]], [[Josh Holsey]], and veteran Dashaun Phillips.<ref name=\"ESPN\"/><ref>{{cite web
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title=5 Washington Redskins position battles to watch during 2017 offseason
column5: website=riggosrag.com}}</ref> Defensive coordinator [[Greg Manusky]] named Fuller the starting nickelback and the third cornerback on the depth chart to begin the regular season, behind starters Josh Norman and Bashaud Breeland.<ref>{{cite web
column6: title=Redskins Depth Chart: Week 1 vs. Philadelphia

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: On September 24, 2017, Fuller recorded three combined tackles, deflected a pass, and made his first career interception off a pass by [[Derek Carr]] during a 27–10 victory against the [[2017 Oakland Raiders season
column5: title=Montae Nicholson, Kendall Fuller Log First Career Interceptions Vs. Raiders
column9: accessdate=October 15, 2017}}</ref> In Week 6, he made a solo tackle, a season-high two pass deflections, and intercepted a pass by quarterback [[C. J. Beathard]] in the last ten seconds of the Redskins' 26–24 victory against the [[2017 San Francisco 49ers season
column13: title=Redskins’ ‘Flight Marshals’ celebrate game-ending interception with a pat-down search
column17: accessdate=December 12, 2017}}</ref> On November 23, 2017, Fuller deflected a pass and recorded another victory-sealing interception against [[Eli Manning]] in the last 1:16 of the Redskins' 20–10 victory against the [[2017 New York Giants season
column21: title=‘Unsung hero’ Fuller provides boost to secondary
column25: accessdate=December 12, 2017}}</ref> In Week 15, he collected a season-high eight combined tackles and two pass deflections during a 20–15 win against the [[2017 Arizona Cardinals season
column31: 2017}} season with 55 combined tackles (43 solo), ten pass deflections, and four interceptions in 16 games and 16 starts.<ref name=\"career\"/>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: On January 30, 2018, the Washington Redskins agreed to trade Fuller and a third round pick (78th overall) in the [[2018 NFL Draft]] to the [[Kansas City Chiefs]] for quarterback [[Alex Smith]].<ref>{{cite news
column4: title=Chiefs trade Alex Smith to Washington, saving $15.6 million
column8: date=January 30, 2018}}</ref> The trade was officially completed on March 14, the start of the new league year.<ref>{{cite web

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Fuller became the No. 1 cornerback on the Kansas City Chiefs’ depth chart after [[Marcus Peters]] was traded to the [[Los Angeles Rams]].<ref>{{cite web

The '''Football League Trophy 1995–96''', known as the '''Auto Windscreens Shield 1995–96''' for sponsorship reasons, was the 13th staging of the [[Football League Trophy]], a knock-out competition for [[English football]] clubs in the [[Football League Second Division
column3: Third]] Divisions (now known as [[Football League One

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Rotherham United]], who defeated [[Shrewsbury Town F.C.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The competition began on 25 September 1995 and ended with the final on 14 April 1996.

The tournament begins with clubs divided into a Northern and a Southern section, and teams entering a group stage. Each section then gradually eliminates the qualifying teams in knock-out fashion until each has a winning finalist. At this point, the two winning finalists face each other in the combined final for the honour of the trophy.
{{refbegin}}''The placings in this group were decided by drawing lots.''{{refend}}

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: <!-- Do not remove these images, Wikipedia is not censored and the current consensus is for this article to have images -->

column3: A woman's pubic area after a partial Brazilian wax]]

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: '''Bikini waxing''' is the removal of [[pubic hair]] using a special wax, which can be hot or cold, that adheres to hairs and pulls them out when the wax is removed quickly from the skin, usually with a cloth strip. While the practice is mainly associated with women, [[male waxing]] is sometimes done to remove men's pubic hair.<ref>{{citation
column5: title=The male resistance to waxing is melting away

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: A '''bikini line''' is the area of the upper leg and inner thigh in which pubic hair grows that is normally not covered by the bottom part of a swimsuit.<ref name=\"Embod1\" /> In some cultures, visible pubic hair in this region is disliked and/or considered embarrassing and so it is sometimes removed.<ref name=\"Embod1\">{{citation
column13: isbn=978-3-8258-6762-1}}</ref> However, some people remove pubic hair that will not be exposed for reasons like aesthetics, personal grooming and hygiene, culture, religion or fashion.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Pubic hair can be removed in a number of ways, such as [[waxing]], [[shaving]], [[Sugaring (epilation)
column3: electrolysis]], [[laser hair removal]] or with [[chemical depilatory]] creams. Waxing involves applying melted, usually hot, wax to the pubic hair that an individual would like to remove. The wax, which adheres to the hair as it hardens, is then covered with small strips of cloth. When the wax hardens sufficiently, the cloth is pulled off quickly, removing the hair from its roots as the wax is pulled away. Waxing can be performed on oneself privately using a home kit or by a [[cosmetologist]] at a salon or spa.<ref name=Cosmo/>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: <!-- Do not remove these images, Wikipedia is not censored and the current consensus is for this article to have images -->

column5: Wax being applied to female pubic hair]]

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: If a person has never been waxed before, or has not been waxed for a long time, it may be necessary to trim the pubic hair using scissors or an electric razor prior to waxing.<ref name=\"milady\">Helen Bickmore; ''Milady's Hair Removal Techniques: A Comprehensive Manual''; Thomson Delmar Learning; 2003; {{ISBN
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: 1-4018-1555-3}}</ref><ref name=\"Ovat\">Lia Schorr, Shari Miller Sims & Shari Sims, ''SalonOvations' Advanced Skin Care Handbook'', pages 94–95, 117-118, Cengage Learning, 1994, {{ISBN
column3: 1-56253-045-3}}</ref> A patch test is recommended, usually on the upper thigh, to test for allergies or skin sensitivities to the ingredients in the wax. Sometimes a hair growth inhibitor is applied after waxing, which slows the regrowth of hair if applied daily for an extended period of time.<ref name=Cosmo>{{citation

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: It is common to apply an antiseptic cleaner and powder to the area prior to waxing. Wax is applied with a spatula in the direction of hair growth the size of a strip about {{convert
column7: cm}} long. When the wax is set but still pliable, the wax strips are pulled away against the direction of hair growth while keeping the skin taut. The strip is ideally pulled off as swiftly as possible.<ref name=milady />

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The pubic area is one of the most sensitive areas in the body and during the procedure special attention must be paid to avoid irritation.{{citation needed
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: date=August 2016}} Pain directly resulting from the procedure can be slight or severe and can continue from several seconds to several minutes. Some people experience less pain during subsequent treatments. It can be helpful to take a mild anti-inflammatory medication (such as [[ibuprofen]]) an hour or so before waxing to reduce potential pain from the waxing.<ref>Michael J. Klag, ''Johns Hopkins Family Health Book'', page 769, HarperCollins, 1999, {{ISBN
column3: 0-06-270149-5}}</ref> Products such as topical anesthetics are available to lessen the pain involved.<ref name=Cosmo/> A bikini wax during pregnancy is generally more painful, due to increased sensitivity.<ref>Linda Murray, Leah Hennen & Jim Scott, ''The Babycenter Essential Guide to Pregnancy and Birth'', page 576, Rodale, 2005, {{ISBN
column4: 1-59486-211-7}}</ref> The type of wax used for bikini lines is often made from a mixture of [[beeswax]] and [[tall oil]] rather than the more common synthetic [[wax]]es used for waxing regular leg hair. Beeswax is considered stronger and more effective at removing the thicker and coarser pubic hair.<ref>Susan Cressy & Margaret Rennie, ''Beauty Therapy Fact File'', page 293, Heinemann, 2004, {{ISBN

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Sometimes bumps or in-grown hair can result from waxing. Isolated hairs can be removed with tweezers or electrolysis.<ref name=\"Ovat\" /> Discomfort following the procedure generally lasts two to five days or less.<ref>Hilda Hutcherson, ''Pleasure'', page 190, Perigee, 2006, {{ISBN
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: 0-399-53286-2}}</ref> Application of [[egg oil]] for a few days post-waxing can help moisturize the skin and reduce inflammation, pain or growth of bacteria.<ref>{{Cite journal
column3: title=Anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects of egg yolk: a comparison between organic and machine made
column11: pages=472–6}}</ref> With repeated removal over time, pubic hair becomes weaker and grows more slowly, leading to easier removal with less pain and less frequent waxing.<ref name=WomansDay>{{cite web
column13: title=Waxing 101: Tips and Tricks for Beginners

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: <!-- Do not remove these images, Wikipedia is not censored and the current consensus is for this article to have images -->

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: caption1  = ''American waxing'': hair is limited to the bikini area and, here, trimmed shorter
image2    = Landing strip pubic hair pattern LQ.jpg
caption2  = ''French waxing'': hair removed entirely except a rectangular \"landing strip\"
caption3  = ''Brazilian waxing'': all hair is removed

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: <!-- Do not remove these images, Wikipedia is not censored and the current consensus is for this article to have images -->

Some people modify their pubic hair either to fit in with societal trends or simply as an expression of their own style or lifestyle, while others object to any styling or do not practice it because of cost considerations.<ref name=telegraph>{{cite news
column10: title=Waxing: Damned if You Do and Damned if You Don’t: How Pubic Hair Became Political

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: \"Natural\" (also known as \"au natural\" or \"bush\") refers to pubic hair that has not been removed, trimmed or styled at all.<ref>{{cite web
column8: accessdate=May 9, 2013}}</ref> \"Trimmed\" or \"cut\" refers to pubic hair that has been shortened, but not completely removed other than shaving the inner thighs. Some women trim, but keep hair on their labia, while removing the pubic hair on the [[mons pubis]]. Pubic hair may be styled into several basic styles<ref name=milady />{{Rp
column14: title=Different Types of Bikini Wax and Application Techniques
column23: url-status=dead }}</ref> which are often referred to by different names.<ref name=SalE>{{cite book
column26: title = The Complete Idiot's Guide to Pleasing Your Woman
column32: url-access = registration }}</ref> Salons often use their own unique names for common types of waxing, for example referring to a Brazilian with a \"landing strip\" as a \"Mohican\" or a \"Hollywood\" as \"Full Monty\".<ref>{{cite book
column47: title=Erotic Review's Bedside Companion: An ABC of Delightful Depravity
column54: quote=Salons offer a choice of waxing styles for women, including the widely renowned Brazilian or Mohican for those concerned not to reveal a single stray pube in the inciest, winciest beachwear, while The Hollywood denotes the full monty.}}</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The three major types are described below:

''American waxing'' is the removal of only the pubic hair that is exposed by a swimsuit, depending on the style of the swimsuit. For a bikini, it would be hair at the top of the thighs and under the navel. It is also known as a \"basic bikini wax\",<ref name=milady /><ref name=essort /><ref name=BrBi /> \"triangle\", or \"bikini line\", as it involves waxing hair from the sides to form a triangle so that pubic hair cannot be seen while wearing a swimsuit.<ref name=landingstrip>{{cite web
column8: date=2012-06-30}}</ref> Bikini bottoms or underwear are usually worn while getting an American wax. A normal American waxing job takes about 20 to 30 minutes to complete.<ref name=milady />

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: ''French waxing'' (sometimes called a ''landing strip'' or a ''partial Brazilian wax'') leaves a vertical strip of pubic hair about {{convert
column7: cm}} long just above the [[vulva]].<ref name=milady /><ref name=essort /><ref name=SalE /> Hair around the anus area and [[labia (genitalia)
column8: labia]] may be removed. The landing strip wax has become popular with models who must wear garments of an extreme narrowness in the crotch region.{{citation needed
column9: date=August 2016}} To create the \"landing strip\" (a line of hair) practitioners and clients prefer either lying face up or lying face down. Sometimes hard wax is used, though strip wax works as effectively.<ref name=milady />

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: ''Brazilian waxing'' (or the ''sphinx wax''<ref name=\"weigle\">Weigle, Elizabeth Anne. The American trend of female pubic hair removal. Diss. uga, 2009.</ref>) is the removal of all pubic hair from the pelvic region, [[vulva]], [[labia]], [[perineum]],<ref name=salon>{{cite web
column15: title = The Ultimate Guide to Cunnilingus
column20: isbn = 978-1-57344-144-5}}</ref> and [[anus]], while sometimes leaving a thin strip of hair on the [[mons pubis]].<ref name=milady /><ref name=essort /><ref name=BrBi /><ref name=SalE /><ref name=Boston>{{cite book
column21: author = Boston Women's Health Book Collective, The
column23: title = Our Bodies, Ourselves: A New Edition for a New Era
column29: title-link = Our Bodies, Ourselves }}</ref> It can be used by those who wear thong bikinis.<ref>{{cite web
column41: df=mdy-all }}</ref> Brazilian waxing is also known as a ''full Brazilian wax'', ''full bikini wax'', or the ''Hollywood wax''.<ref name=milady /><ref name=BrBi /><ref name=SalE /> This style was first called the Brazilian wax by the J. Sisters salon in [[Manhattan]], founded in 1987 by seven sisters named Padilha from [[Brazil]].<ref>{{cite news
column43: title=The New Full-Frontal: Has Pubic Hair in America Gone Extinct?
column49: title=The women who invented the Brazilian wax

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Brazilian waxing is more controversial than other types of waxing.<ref name=KirM>{{cite book
column4: title = The Girl's Guide to Absolutely Everything
column13: title = Guide to Getting It On
column17: pages=233–246, 528–531}}</ref> Like all waxing, it can be a physically painful experience during and after waxing.<ref name=salon /><ref name=\"Joannides (2006)\" /><ref name=BVio/><ref name=GodS>{{cite book
column20: title = Sexploration: An Edgy Encyclopedia of Everything Sexual
column24: pages=89, 161}}</ref> Some believe it is more unpleasant to receive [[cunnilingus]] from a bearded partner after getting a Brazilian wax.<ref name=\"Joannides (2006)\" /><ref name=GodS /> Some critics of the procedure believe that Brazilian waxing can contribute to making an adult woman look underage, claiming that this may be one reason for its popularity in the [[sex industry]].<ref name=Boston /><ref name=KirM /><ref name=GodS /> There is also a health risk involved if it is not done properly, as well as a risk of infection if done on a person with a weakened immune system.<ref name=Tweed>{{cite news

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title=Woman Almost Dies After Bikini Wax

the Journal of the American Medical Association]] published a study in which it was found that out of 3,316 American women surveyed, 84% reported a history of lifetime pubic hair grooming, with 59% reporting that the primary motivations for grooming were for hygienic purposes.<ref name=\":0\">{{Cite journal
column10: title=Pubic Hair Grooming Prevalence and Motivation Among Women in the United States
column20: title=Most Women Prefer to Go Bare, Citing Hygiene (and Baffling Doctors)

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Bikini waxing has been credited with a significant global reduction in cases of [[pubic lice]].<ref>{{cite web
column3: title=Brazilian Bikini Waxes Make Crab Lice Endangered Species
column8: author2=Shannon Pettypiece}}</ref> However, the medical community has also seen a recent increase in [[folliculitis]], or infection around the hair follicle, in women who wax or shave their bikini areas.<ref>{{cite book
column15: title=Primary Care of Women: A Guide for Midwives and Women's Health Providers

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In [[Islam]], the removal of unwanted body hair is known as an act of ''[[fitrah]]''.{{cn
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: date=January 2020}} According to ethnologist F. Fawcett, writing in 1901, he had observed the removal of body hair, including pubic hair about the [[vulva]], as a custom of women from the [[Hindu]] [[Nair]] caste.<ref>{{cite book
column12: Western]] societies, removal of female body hair (except for head hair, eyelashes and eyebrows) has traditionally been considered appropriate when it was visible.<ref name=Embod1 />

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In relation to pubic hair, with the reduction in the size of swimsuits, especially since the coming into fashion and popularity of the [[bikini]] since 1946, and the elimination of the skirt on swimsuits, the styling of pubic hair has also come into vogue.<ref name=Embod1 /> The practice to remove more pubic hair continued with the popularity or fashion of even briefer swimwear, such as the [[Thong (clothing)
Changes in lingerie styles also encouraged the removal of pubic hair,<ref name=milady />{{Rp
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: page=139}} and the nude crotch{{nsmdns}}i.e., the total removal of pubic hair, such as in a full Brazilian or the Sphinx style{{nsmdns}}became considered by many to be [[erotic]] and [[Glamour (presentation)
column3: glamorous]]. A nude crotch is considered by some to be more youthful looking.<ref name=Embod1 />{{Rp
column4: 59}} According to Tschachler, Devine and Draxlbauer, removal of all visible body hair has come to be seen as an important aspect of femininity.<ref name=Embod1 />{{Rp

column13: title = Guide to Getting It On
column17: pages=233–246, 528–531}}</ref> Like all waxing, it can be a physically painful experience during and after waxing.<ref name=salon /><ref name=\"Joannides (2006)\" /><ref name=BVio/><ref name=GodS>{{cite book
column20: title = Sexploration: An Edgy Encyclopedia of Everything Sexual
column24: pages=89, 161}}</ref> Some believe it is more unpleasant to receive [[cunnilingus]] from a bearded partner after getting a Brazilian wax.<ref name=\"Joannides (2006)\" /><ref name=GodS /> Some critics of the procedure believe that Brazilian waxing can contribute to making an adult woman look underage, claiming that this may be one reason for its popularity in the [[sex industry]].<ref name=Boston /><ref name=KirM /><ref name=GodS /> There is also a health risk involved if it is not done properly, as well as a risk of infection if done on a person with a weakened immune system.<ref name=Tweed>{{cite news

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title=Woman Almost Dies After Bikini Wax

the Journal of the American Medical Association]] published a study in which it was found that out of 3,316 American women surveyed, 84% reported a history of lifetime pubic hair grooming, with 59% reporting that the primary motivations for grooming were for hygienic purposes.<ref name=\":0\">{{Cite journal
column10: title=Pubic Hair Grooming Prevalence and Motivation Among Women in the United States
column20: title=Most Women Prefer to Go Bare, Citing Hygiene (and Baffling Doctors)

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Bikini waxing has been credited with a significant global reduction in cases of [[pubic lice]].<ref>{{cite web
column3: title=Brazilian Bikini Waxes Make Crab Lice Endangered Species
column8: author2=Shannon Pettypiece}}</ref> However, the medical community has also seen a recent increase in [[folliculitis]], or infection around the hair follicle, in women who wax or shave their bikini areas.<ref>{{cite book
column15: title=Primary Care of Women: A Guide for Midwives and Women's Health Providers

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In [[Islam]], the removal of unwanted body hair is known as an act of ''[[fitrah]]''.{{cn
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: date=January 2020}} According to ethnologist F. Fawcett, writing in 1901, he had observed the removal of body hair, including pubic hair about the [[vulva]], as a custom of women from the [[Hindu]] [[Nair]] caste.<ref>{{cite book
column12: Western]] societies, removal of female body hair (except for head hair, eyelashes and eyebrows) has traditionally been considered appropriate when it was visible.<ref name=Embod1 />

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In relation to pubic hair, with the reduction in the size of swimsuits, especially since the coming into fashion and popularity of the [[bikini]] since 1946, and the elimination of the skirt on swimsuits, the styling of pubic hair has also come into vogue.<ref name=Embod1 /> The practice to remove more pubic hair continued with the popularity or fashion of even briefer swimwear, such as the [[Thong (clothing)
Changes in lingerie styles also encouraged the removal of pubic hair,<ref name=milady />{{Rp
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: page=139}} and the nude crotch{{nsmdns}}i.e., the total removal of pubic hair, such as in a full Brazilian or the Sphinx style{{nsmdns}}became considered by many to be [[erotic]] and [[Glamour (presentation)
column3: glamorous]]. A nude crotch is considered by some to be more youthful looking.<ref name=Embod1 />{{Rp
column4: 59}} According to Tschachler, Devine and Draxlbauer, removal of all visible body hair has come to be seen as an important aspect of femininity.<ref name=Embod1 />{{Rp

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: →‎2011 Fast Track 100 list:added link,safe,Sidesix,"{{Use British English

The '''Sunday Times Fast Track 100''' is a list published annually in December in partnership with [[The Sunday Times]] newspaper in the UK. It ranks Britain's fastest-growing privately-held companies by sales growth (% per annum) over the last three years. The list is produced by Fast Track, an Oxford-based research company, and has been sponsored by the [[Virgin Group]] since 1996.<ref>{{Cite web
column3: title=Entrepreneurs are the lifeblood of UK business

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The Fast Track 100 is generally promoted as the definitive guide to the fastest growing privately held companies in the UK. [[Richard Branson]] is quoted as saying ''\"Fast Track has become the definitive barometer of growth companies\"'' However a number of limitations exists which mean that the list may not contain information on many fast growing companies.  Most important of these is the reliance on historical data.  Because Fast Track only deals in publicly available information generally from published accounts, the league table refers to data that is sometimes as much as 10 months out of date.
On the other hand, this method ensures objectivity and has led to the early identification of a number of household names, including [[Carphone Warehouse]], [[British Home Stores]] and [[Travelex]].
For entry to the 2013 Fast Track 100 companies were required to be:
* Annualised sales of at least £250,000 in 2009/10
* Annualised sales of at least £5m in 2012/13
* An increase in sales from penultimate to latest year, and a forecast of further sales growth
Fast Track 100 is one of seven business lists of private companies produced by Fast Track and published in the Sunday Times:
* Fast Track 100 - Fastest growth in sales
* [[Tech Track 100]] - Fastest growth in sales for 'tech' companies
* International Track 200 - Fastest growth in overseas sales
* [[Top Track 100]]- Biggest private companies based on sales
