Correct citation errors (deprecated dead-url parameters), and genfixes, addeduncategorisedtag,safe,TAnthony,"[[File:Haar1.JPG
column4: A [[cat]] hair showing light and dark bands caused by alternating production of [[agouti-signaling protein]] and [[alpha-Melanocyte-stimulating hormone

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: ASIP]]) is responsible for variations in color in many species. ''Agouti'' works with ''[[extension gene
column3: extension]]'' to regulate the color of [[melanin]] which is produced in hairs. The agouti protein causes red to yellow pheomelanin to be produced, while the competing molecule [[Alpha-Melanocyte-stimulating hormone
column4: α-MSH]] signals production of brown to black eumelanin. In wildtype mice, alternating cycles of agouti and α-MSH production cause [[agouti (coloration)
column5: agouti coloration]]. Each hair has bands of yellow which grew during agouti production, and black which grew during α-MSH production. Wildtype mice also have light-colored bellies. The hairs there are a creamy color the whole length because the agouti protein was produced the whole time the hairs were growing.<ref name=Furumura1996>{{cite journal
column6: title = The Interaction of Agouti Signal Protein and Melanocyte Stimulating Hormone to Regulate Melanin Formation in Mammals

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In mice and other species, loss of function mutations generally cause a darker color, while gain of function mutations cause a yellower coat.<ref name=Fontanesi2010/>

column4: Both of these mice are viable yellow agouti a<sup>vy</sup>; however, the mouse on the right does not express it due to epigenetic methylation.]]

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: As of 1979, there were 17 known alleles of agouti in mice.<ref name=Silvers1979>{{cite web
column3: title=The Agouti and Extension series of Alleles, Umbrous and Sable
column10: date=1979}}<!-- What to do with a book published in 1979, posted on the web in 2003, and revised in 2008? --></ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: *Lethal yellow ''A<sup>y</sup>'' causes yellow coloration and obesity. It is dominant to all other alleles in the series. When homozygous, it is lethal early in development.<ref name=Silvers1979/>

*Viable yellow ''A<sup>vy</sup>'' looks similar to lethal yellow and also causes obesity, but is not lethal when homozygous. Homozygous viable yellow mice can be variable in color from clear yellow through mottled black and yellow to a darker color similar to the agouti color.<ref name=Silvers1979/>
*Intermediate yellow ''a<sup>iy</sup>'' causes a mottled yellow coloration, which like viable yellow can sometimes resemble agouti.<ref name=Silvers1979/>
*Sienna yellow ''A<sup>sy</sup>'' heterozygotes are a dark yellow, while homozygotes are generally a clearer yellow.<ref name=Silvers1979/>
*White-bellied agouti ''A<sup>W</sup>'' mice have agouti coloration, with hairs that are black at the tips, then yellow, then black again, and white to tan bellies.<ref name=Silvers1979/>
*Agouti A looks like ''A<sup>W</sup>'' but the belly is dark like the back.<ref name=Silvers1979/>
*Black and tan ''a<sup>t</sup>'' causes a black back with a tan belly. ''A/a<sup>t</sup>'' heterozygotes look like ''A<sup>W</sup>'' mice.<ref name=Silvers1979/>
*Nonagouti ''a'' mice are almost completely black, with only a few yellow hairs around the ears and the genitals.<ref name=Silvers1979/>
*Extreme nonagouti ''a<sup>e</sup>'' mice are fully black, and is recessive to all other alleles in the series.<ref name=Silvers1979/>
This is not a complete list of mouse agouti alleles.

Lethal yellow and viable yellow cause [[obesity]], features of type II [[diabetes]], and a higher likelihood of tumors.<ref name=OMIM-ASIP/> In normal mice ''Agouti'' is only expressed in the skin during hair growth, but these dominant yellow mutations cause it to be expressed in other [[tissue (biology)
column4: vauthors = Klebig ML, Wilkinson JE, Geisler JG, Woychik RP
column5: title = Ectopic expression of the agouti gene in transgenic mice causes obesity, features of type II diabetes, and yellow fur
column6: journal = Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The mouse agouti gene is found on chromosome 2.<ref name=OMIM-ASIP/>
[[File:Bucuresti, Romania, acelasi dulau, frumos de Cotroceni.JPG
column4: An agouti dog, also called wolf sable]]

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In [[dog]]s, the agouti gene is associated with various coat colors and patterns.<ref>{{Cite web
The alleles at the A locus are related to the production of agouti-signaling protein (ASIP) and determine whether an animal expresses an [[agouti gene
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: agouti]] appearance and, by controlling the distribution of pigment in individual hairs, what type of agouti. There are four known alleles that occur at the A locus:

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: * ''A<sup>y</sup>'' = Fawn or sable (tan with black whiskers and varying amounts of black-tipped and/or all-black hairs dispersed throughout) - fawn typically referring to dogs with clearer tan and sable to those with more black shading
* ''a<sup>w</sup>'' = Wild-type agouti (each hair with 3-6 bands alternating black and tan) - also called wolf sable
* ''a<sup>t</sup>'' = Tan point (black with tan patches on the face and underside) - including saddle tan (tan with a black saddle or blanket) <ref>{{cite journal
column3: title = A SINE insertion causes the black-and-tan and saddle tan phenotypes in domestic dogs
column11: vauthors = Dreger DL, Parker HG, Ostrander EA, Schmutz SM
column12: title = Identification of a mutation that is associated with the saddle tan and black-and-tan phenotypes in Basset Hounds and Pembroke Welsh Corgis

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: * ''a<sup>yt</sup>'' = Recombinant fawn (black with tan patches on the face and underside) has been identified in numerous Tibetan Spaniels and a Tibetan Mastiff. Its hierarchical position is not yet understood.

Most texts suggest that the dominance hierarchy for the A locus alleles appears to be as follows: ''A<sup>y</sup> > a<sup>w</sup> > a<sup>t</sup> > a''; however, research suggests the existence of pairwise dominance/recessiveness relationships in different families and not the existence of a single hierarchy in one family.<ref>{{cite journal
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: vauthors = Kerns JA, Newton J, Berryere TG, Rubin EM, Cheng JF, Schmutz SM, Barsh GS
column3: title = Characterization of the dog Agouti gene and a nonagoutimutation in German Shepherd Dogs

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: * ''A<sup>y</sup>'' is incompletely dominant to ''a<sup>t</sup>'', so that heterozygous individuals have more black sabling, especially as puppies and ''A<sup>y</sup>a<sup>t</sup>'' can resemble the ''a<sup>w</sup>a<sup>w</sup>'' phenotype. Other genes also affect how much black is in the coat.
* ''a<sup>w</sup>'' is the only allele present in many Nordic spitzes, and is not present in most other breeds.

* ''a<sup>t</sup>'' includes tan point and saddle tan, both of which look tan point at birth. Modifier genes in saddle tan puppies cause a gradual reduction of the black area until the saddle tan pattern is achieved.
* ''a'' is only present in a handful of breeds. Most black dogs are black due to a K locus allele.
The dominant, wild-type ''A'' allows hairs to be banded with black and red (revealing the underlying [[Tabby cat
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: tabby]] pattern), while the recessive ''non-agouti'' or \"hypermelanistic\" allele, ''a'', causes black pigment production throughout the growth cycle of the hair.<ref>{{cite journal
column3: vauthors = Eizirik E, Yuhki N, Johnson WE, Menotti-Raymond M, Hannah SS, O'Brien SJ
column4: title = Molecular genetics and evolution of melanism in the cat family
column11: doi = 10.1016/S0960-9822(03)00128-3 }}</ref> Thus, the non-agouti genotype (aa) masks or hides the tabby pattern, although sometimes a suggestion of the underlying pattern can be seen (called \"ghost striping\"), especially in kittens. The sex-linked orange coloration is [[epistatic]] over agouti, and prevents the production of black pigment.

column3: Tabby]] pattern thanks to a functional agouti gene.
Black]], which lacks a functional agouti gene and so cannot signal [[MC1R]] to produce red pigment.

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: A 2 base pair [[frameshift]] deletion thought to cause a complete loss of function<ref>{{cite paper
column3: title=Molecular genetics and evolution of melanism in the cat family
column4: vauthors= Eizirik E, Yuhki N, Johnson WE, Menotti-Raymond M, Hannah SS, O'Brien SJ
column13: vauthors = Kaelin CB, Xu X, Hong LZ, David VA, McGowan KA, Schmidt-Küntzel A, Roelke ME, Pino J, Pontius J, Cooper GM, Manuel H, Swanson WF, Marker L, Harper CK, van Dyk A, Yue B, Mullikin JC, Warren WC, Eizirik E, Kos L, O'Brien SJ, Barsh GS, Menotti-Raymond M
column14: title = Specifying and sustaining pigmentation patterns in domestic and wild cats

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: ASIP]] restricts the production of eumelanin to the \"points\": the legs, mane, tail, ear edges, etc.<ref name=VGLintro-A>{{cite web
column4: title=Gene A: Distribution of Black Pigmented Hair
column6: access-date=2009-05-26}}</ref> In 2001, researchers discovered a recessive mutation on ''ASIP'' that, when homozygous, left the horse without any functional ASIP. As a result, horses capable of producing true black pigment had uniformly black coats.<ref name=\"Rieder_2001\" /> The dominant, [[wildtype]] [[allele]] producing [[bay (horse)
column7: bay]] is symbolized as ''A'', while the [[recessive]] allele producing [[black (horse)
column8: black]] is symbolized as ''a''. ''Extension'' is [[epistatic]] over ''agouti'' and will cause [[chestnut (coat)
column9: chestnut]] coloration regardless of what ''agouti'' alleles are present.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: A hypothesized third option, ''A<sup>t</sup>'', might restrict black pigment to a black-and-tan pattern called [[Seal brown (horse)
column10: df= }}</ref> This allele would be recessive to ''A'' and dominant to ''a'', such that horses with the genotype ''A/A<sup>t</sup>'' appear bay, while ''A<sup>t</sup>/A<sup>t</sup>'' and ''A<sup>t</sup>/a'' horses are seal brown in the presence of a dominant ''Extension'' allele ''E''. One genetics testing lab began offering a test for ''A<sup>t</sup>'',<ref name=PETDNAAZ /> but it was later found to be inaccurate and is no longer offered.

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Wild bay pattern, like bay but the black does not extend so far up the legs

column3: Bay]] pattern due to a functional agouti gene. The body is red while the \"points\", the mane, tail, and lower legs, are black.
Seal brown]] color, mostly black but with some red on the flanks, muzzle, and around the eyes
Black]] horses produce black pigment in the entire coat because they lack a functional Agouti protein.

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: An 11 base pair frameshift deletion in exon 2<ref name=\"Rieder_2001\">{{cite journal
column3: vauthors = Rieder S, Taourit S, Mariat D, Langlois B, Guérin G
column4: title = Mutations in the agouti (ASIP), the extension (MC1R), and the brown (TYRP1) loci and their association to coat color phenotypes in horses (Equus caballus)
column13: quote = The 11-bp deletion in ASIP exon 2 (ADEx2) alters the amino acid sequence and is believed to extend the regular termination signal by 210 bp to 612 bp. The frameshift initiated by the deletion results in a novel modified agouti-signaling-protein. ADEx2 was completely associated with horse recessive black coat color (A<sup>a</sup>/A<sup>a</sup>) in all horses typed so far }}</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The cause behind the various shades of bay, particularly the genetic factors responsible for wild bay and [[seal brown (horse)
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: seal brown]], have been contested for over 50 years. In 1951, zoologist [[Miguel Odriozola]] published \"A los colores del caballo\" in which he suggested four possible alleles for the \"A\" gene, ''A+'', ''A'', ''A<sup>t</sup>'', and ''a'', in order of most dominant to least.<ref name=Castle>{{cite journal

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: This was accepted until the 1990s, when a new theory became popular.<ref name=Kostelnik>{{cite web
column9: archive-date= 3 March 2008 <!--DASHBot-->}}</ref> The new theory suggested that shades of bay were caused by many different genes, some which lightened the coat, some which darkened it. This theory also suggested that seal brown horses were black horses with a trait called ''pangare''. Pangaré is an ancestral trait also called \"mealy\", which outlines the soft or communicative parts of the horse in buff tan.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The combination of black and pangaré was dismissed as the cause of brown in 2001, when a French research team published ''Mutations in the agouti (ASIP), the extension (MC1R), and the brown (TYRP1) loci and their association to coat color phenotypes in horses (Equus caballus)''. This study used a DNA test to identify the recessive ''a'' allele on the Agouti locus, and found that none of the horses fitting the phenotype of seal brown were homozygous for the ''a'' allele.<ref name=\"Rieder_2001\"/>
Since 2001, the mechanisms of the variations within the \"bay\" category remain unclear. Ongoing research suggests that Odriozola's theories may have been correct,<ref name=Morgan>{{cite web
column13: df= }}</ref> evidenced by a parallel condition in mice. Mice have several alleles at the Agouti locus, including A<sup>t</sup> which produces black-and-tan.<ref name=Mouse>{{cite journal
column14: vauthors = Hustad CM, Perry WL, Siracusa LD, Rasberry C, Cobb L, Cattanach BM, Kovatch R, Copeland NG, Jenkins NA
column15: title = Molecular genetic characterization of six recessive viable alleles of the mouse agouti locus

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In rabbits, the wildtype is agouti with a light belly, and a recessive non-agouti allele causes a black coat. A third allele, possibly a mutation to a regulator or promoter region, is thought to cause black and tan color. The nonagouti allele is estimated to have first appeared before 1700.<ref name=Fontanesi2010>{{cite journal
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title = Characterization of the rabbit agouti signaling protein (ASIP) gene: Transcripts and phylogenetic analyses and identification of the causative mutation of the nonagouti black coat colour

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: ''Agouti'' is linked to the ''wideband'' gene, with about a 30% crossover rate.<ref name=Sawin1934>{{cite journal
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title = LINKAGE OF \"WIDE-BAND\" AND \"AGOUTI\" GENES: The Agouti Gene and a Modifier Shown to Be Situated on the Same Chromosome in the Domesticated Rabbit

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Like white bellied agouti mice, rabbits with wildtype agouti produce transcripts with different untranslated 5' ends that have different dorsal and ventral expression. The 1A exon is only expressed in the belly region and may be responsible for the lighter color there.<ref name=Fontanesi2010/>

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Chestnut, sometimes called agouti. Hairs are banded black and yellow, and the belly is light. This resembles the mouse's light bellied agouti.
Black otter, black with a white belly. [[Tan rabbit]]s are all this color, but also have the wideband pattern and rufous color causing their bellies to be fiery orange.
Thought to exist from classical genetics studies, but not found molecularly. May be on a promoter or regulator of ''agouti''.
Black self. All hairs are fully black.
Single base pair frameshift insertion in exon 2 causing loss of function<ref name=Fontanesi2010/>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In [[dog]]s, the agouti gene is associated with various coat colors and patterns.<ref>{{Cite web
The alleles at the A locus are related to the production of agouti-signaling protein (ASIP) and determine whether an animal expresses an [[agouti gene
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: agouti]] appearance and, by controlling the distribution of pigment in individual hairs, what type of agouti. There are four known alleles that occur at the A locus:

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: * ''A<sup>y</sup>'' = Fawn or sable (tan with black whiskers and varying amounts of black-tipped and/or all-black hairs dispersed throughout) - fawn typically referring to dogs with clearer tan and sable to those with more black shading
* ''a<sup>w</sup>'' = Wild-type agouti (each hair with 3-6 bands alternating black and tan) - also called wolf sable
* ''a<sup>t</sup>'' = Tan point (black with tan patches on the face and underside) - including saddle tan (tan with a black saddle or blanket) <ref>{{cite journal
column3: title = A SINE insertion causes the black-and-tan and saddle tan phenotypes in domestic dogs
column11: vauthors = Dreger DL, Parker HG, Ostrander EA, Schmutz SM
column12: title = Identification of a mutation that is associated with the saddle tan and black-and-tan phenotypes in Basset Hounds and Pembroke Welsh Corgis

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: * ''a<sup>yt</sup>'' = Recombinant fawn (black with tan patches on the face and underside) has been identified in numerous Tibetan Spaniels and a Tibetan Mastiff. Its hierarchical position is not yet understood.

Most texts suggest that the dominance hierarchy for the A locus alleles appears to be as follows: ''A<sup>y</sup> > a<sup>w</sup> > a<sup>t</sup> > a''; however, research suggests the existence of pairwise dominance/recessiveness relationships in different families and not the existence of a single hierarchy in one family.<ref>{{cite journal
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: vauthors = Kerns JA, Newton J, Berryere TG, Rubin EM, Cheng JF, Schmutz SM, Barsh GS
column3: title = Characterization of the dog Agouti gene and a nonagoutimutation in German Shepherd Dogs

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: * ''A<sup>y</sup>'' is incompletely dominant to ''a<sup>t</sup>'', so that heterozygous individuals have more black sabling, especially as puppies and ''A<sup>y</sup>a<sup>t</sup>'' can resemble the ''a<sup>w</sup>a<sup>w</sup>'' phenotype. Other genes also affect how much black is in the coat.
* ''a<sup>w</sup>'' is the only allele present in many Nordic spitzes, and is not present in most other breeds.

* ''a<sup>t</sup>'' includes tan point and saddle tan, both of which look tan point at birth. Modifier genes in saddle tan puppies cause a gradual reduction of the black area until the saddle tan pattern is achieved.
* ''a'' is only present in a handful of breeds. Most black dogs are black due to a K locus allele.
The dominant, wild-type ''A'' allows hairs to be banded with black and red (revealing the underlying [[Tabby cat
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: tabby]] pattern), while the recessive ''non-agouti'' or \"hypermelanistic\" allele, ''a'', causes black pigment production throughout the growth cycle of the hair.<ref>{{cite journal
column3: vauthors = Eizirik E, Yuhki N, Johnson WE, Menotti-Raymond M, Hannah SS, O'Brien SJ
column4: title = Molecular genetics and evolution of melanism in the cat family
column11: doi = 10.1016/S0960-9822(03)00128-3 }}</ref> Thus, the non-agouti genotype (aa) masks or hides the tabby pattern, although sometimes a suggestion of the underlying pattern can be seen (called \"ghost striping\"), especially in kittens. The sex-linked orange coloration is [[epistatic]] over agouti, and prevents the production of black pigment.

column3: Tabby]] pattern thanks to a functional agouti gene.
Black]], which lacks a functional agouti gene and so cannot signal [[MC1R]] to produce red pigment.

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: A 2 base pair [[frameshift]] deletion thought to cause a complete loss of function<ref>{{cite paper
column3: title=Molecular genetics and evolution of melanism in the cat family
column4: vauthors= Eizirik E, Yuhki N, Johnson WE, Menotti-Raymond M, Hannah SS, O'Brien SJ
column13: vauthors = Kaelin CB, Xu X, Hong LZ, David VA, McGowan KA, Schmidt-Küntzel A, Roelke ME, Pino J, Pontius J, Cooper GM, Manuel H, Swanson WF, Marker L, Harper CK, van Dyk A, Yue B, Mullikin JC, Warren WC, Eizirik E, Kos L, O'Brien SJ, Barsh GS, Menotti-Raymond M
column14: title = Specifying and sustaining pigmentation patterns in domestic and wild cats

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: ASIP]] restricts the production of eumelanin to the \"points\": the legs, mane, tail, ear edges, etc.<ref name=VGLintro-A>{{cite web
column4: title=Gene A: Distribution of Black Pigmented Hair
column6: access-date=2009-05-26}}</ref> In 2001, researchers discovered a recessive mutation on ''ASIP'' that, when homozygous, left the horse without any functional ASIP. As a result, horses capable of producing true black pigment had uniformly black coats.<ref name=\"Rieder_2001\" /> The dominant, [[wildtype]] [[allele]] producing [[bay (horse)
column7: bay]] is symbolized as ''A'', while the [[recessive]] allele producing [[black (horse)
column8: black]] is symbolized as ''a''. ''Extension'' is [[epistatic]] over ''agouti'' and will cause [[chestnut (coat)
column9: chestnut]] coloration regardless of what ''agouti'' alleles are present.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: A hypothesized third option, ''A<sup>t</sup>'', might restrict black pigment to a black-and-tan pattern called [[Seal brown (horse)
column10: df= }}</ref> This allele would be recessive to ''A'' and dominant to ''a'', such that horses with the genotype ''A/A<sup>t</sup>'' appear bay, while ''A<sup>t</sup>/A<sup>t</sup>'' and ''A<sup>t</sup>/a'' horses are seal brown in the presence of a dominant ''Extension'' allele ''E''. One genetics testing lab began offering a test for ''A<sup>t</sup>'',<ref name=PETDNAAZ /> but it was later found to be inaccurate and is no longer offered.

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Wild bay pattern, like bay but the black does not extend so far up the legs

column3: Bay]] pattern due to a functional agouti gene. The body is red while the \"points\", the mane, tail, and lower legs, are black.
Seal brown]] color, mostly black but with some red on the flanks, muzzle, and around the eyes
Black]] horses produce black pigment in the entire coat because they lack a functional Agouti protein.

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: An 11 base pair frameshift deletion in exon 2<ref name=\"Rieder_2001\">{{cite journal
column3: vauthors = Rieder S, Taourit S, Mariat D, Langlois B, Guérin G
column4: title = Mutations in the agouti (ASIP), the extension (MC1R), and the brown (TYRP1) loci and their association to coat color phenotypes in horses (Equus caballus)
column13: quote = The 11-bp deletion in ASIP exon 2 (ADEx2) alters the amino acid sequence and is believed to extend the regular termination signal by 210 bp to 612 bp. The frameshift initiated by the deletion results in a novel modified agouti-signaling-protein. ADEx2 was completely associated with horse recessive black coat color (A<sup>a</sup>/A<sup>a</sup>) in all horses typed so far }}</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The cause behind the various shades of bay, particularly the genetic factors responsible for wild bay and [[seal brown (horse)
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: seal brown]], have been contested for over 50 years. In 1951, zoologist [[Miguel Odriozola]] published \"A los colores del caballo\" in which he suggested four possible alleles for the \"A\" gene, ''A+'', ''A'', ''A<sup>t</sup>'', and ''a'', in order of most dominant to least.<ref name=Castle>{{cite journal

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: This was accepted until the 1990s, when a new theory became popular.<ref name=Kostelnik>{{cite web
column9: archive-date= 3 March 2008 <!--DASHBot-->}}</ref> The new theory suggested that shades of bay were caused by many different genes, some which lightened the coat, some which darkened it. This theory also suggested that seal brown horses were black horses with a trait called ''pangare''. Pangaré is an ancestral trait also called \"mealy\", which outlines the soft or communicative parts of the horse in buff tan.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The combination of black and pangaré was dismissed as the cause of brown in 2001, when a French research team published ''Mutations in the agouti (ASIP), the extension (MC1R), and the brown (TYRP1) loci and their association to coat color phenotypes in horses (Equus caballus)''. This study used a DNA test to identify the recessive ''a'' allele on the Agouti locus, and found that none of the horses fitting the phenotype of seal brown were homozygous for the ''a'' allele.<ref name=\"Rieder_2001\"/>
Since 2001, the mechanisms of the variations within the \"bay\" category remain unclear. Ongoing research suggests that Odriozola's theories may have been correct,<ref name=Morgan>{{cite web
column13: df= }}</ref> evidenced by a parallel condition in mice. Mice have several alleles at the Agouti locus, including A<sup>t</sup> which produces black-and-tan.<ref name=Mouse>{{cite journal
column14: vauthors = Hustad CM, Perry WL, Siracusa LD, Rasberry C, Cobb L, Cattanach BM, Kovatch R, Copeland NG, Jenkins NA
column15: title = Molecular genetic characterization of six recessive viable alleles of the mouse agouti locus

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In rabbits, the wildtype is agouti with a light belly, and a recessive non-agouti allele causes a black coat. A third allele, possibly a mutation to a regulator or promoter region, is thought to cause black and tan color. The nonagouti allele is estimated to have first appeared before 1700.<ref name=Fontanesi2010>{{cite journal
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title = Characterization of the rabbit agouti signaling protein (ASIP) gene: Transcripts and phylogenetic analyses and identification of the causative mutation of the nonagouti black coat colour

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: ''Agouti'' is linked to the ''wideband'' gene, with about a 30% crossover rate.<ref name=Sawin1934>{{cite journal
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title = LINKAGE OF “WIDE-BAND” AND “AGOUTI” GENES: The Agouti Gene and a Modifier Shown to Be Situated on the Same Chromosome in the Domesticated Rabbit

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Like white bellied agouti mice, rabbits with wildtype agouti produce transcripts with different untranslated 5' ends that have different dorsal and ventral expression. The 1A exon is only expressed in the belly region and may be responsible for the lighter color there.<ref name=Fontanesi2010/>

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Chestnut, sometimes called agouti. Hairs are banded black and yellow, and the belly is light. This resembles the mouse's light bellied agouti.
Black otter, black with a white belly. [[Tan rabbit]]s are all this color, but also have the wideband pattern and rufous color causing their bellies to be fiery orange.
Thought to exist from classical genetics studies, but not found molecularly. May be on a promoter or regulator of ''agouti''.
Black self. All hairs are fully black.
Single base pair frameshift insertion in exon 2 causing loss of function<ref name=Fontanesi2010/>
vauthors = Millar SE, Miller MW, Stevens ME, Barsh GS
column3: title = Expression and transgenic studies of the mouse agouti gene provide insight into the mechanisms by which mammalian coat color patterns are generated

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In 2018, Shu team up with [[Arron Blake]] and they both co-directed, wrote, and produced ''[[His Hands (film)
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: His Hands]] (2019),'' with Shu shooting the film as the cinematographer. This was their directorial debut and the first film they made together starring Arron Blake and Philip Brisebois. ''His Hands'' had its world premiere at [[Robert De Niro]]'s [[Tribeca Film Festival]] 2019 in [[New York City
column3: New York]]. The film received nomination for Best Narrative Short.<ref name=\":0\" /><ref name=\":1\" /><ref name=\"autogenerated3\">{{Cite web
column5: title=Two Men Have a Psychosexual Encounter in New Short Film
column9: access-date=2020-02-21}}</ref> The film created a whole new experience as it was a silent psychological thriller, using only the power of visual storytelling and cinematography.<ref name=\"autogenerated2\">{{Cite web
column11: title='His Hands' review: 'An erotic and unsettling short film of striking power'
column15: access-date=2020-02-21}}</ref> It tells the story of two men meeting for the most unusual unanimity of their lives as it touches themes such as sexuality, loneliness, identity and ageism.<ref name=\"autogenerated2\" /><ref name=\"autogenerated3\" />  The film was applauded as a cinematic masterpiece as it was made on a low budget of £400, with no dialogue delivery throughout the film and using only natural light during filming.<ref name=\"autogenerated1\">{{Cite web
column17: title=Film with budget of £400 premiered at world leading film festival
column21: access-date=2020-02-21}}</ref> The film was released on [[Prime Video
column22: Amazon Prime Video]] and has received rave 5 star reviews from the public with critical acclaim.<ref>{{Cite web

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In 2019, Shu team up to shoot a film with director [[Rikki Beadle-Blair
column4: title=Bridge The Moon on Instagram: “Our producers held our 1st meeting @bafta to kickstart pre-production for our upcoming film ‘Tainted’. ⠀ ⠀ Directed by the inimitable…”
column7: access-date=2020-03-28}}</ref> He has also shot a commercial for [[Chanel]] and [[Coach New York
column8: Coach]] where he was flown over to New York to film with seven celebrities from [[Southeast Asia
column9: South East Asia]]. Shu attended Chanel's prestigious fashion show during [[Paris Fashion Week]] in France to shoot for Chanel with singer-songwriter [[Yuna (singer)
column10: Yuna]] and The Laterals magazine.<ref>{{Cite web
column12: title=DARIUS SHU on Instagram: \"ACT II: THE STREET ⠀ @chanelofficial @thelaterals featuring @yuna. ⠀ #HANDBAGCHANEL19 ⠀ ⠀ Cinematography by Darius Shu⠀ Produced by…\"

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Later that year, Shu reunited with director Yewweng Ho on a new [[dyslexia]] film, ''Mical (2020)''. It follows the true story of Pat and Mike Jones on the struggles and journey of being dyslexic.<ref>{{Cite web
column6: access-date=2020-03-18}}</ref> The film is to create awareness on dyslexia and to support the Dyslexia Trust.<ref>{{Cite web

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In 2020, Shu is currently working with [[Shiva Raichandani]] on his new British-Asian drama-musical film ''Queer Parivaar'' based on an interfaith queer wedding.<ref>{{Cite web

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Attitude]] magazine, reviewed Shu's film ''[[His Hands (film)
column3: His Hands]] (2019)'' calling, \"the cinematography is beautiful, modern and stylish. ''His Hands'' is a powerful film that says a lot without “saying” anything at all. Its themes and images converge to create a stylish, dynamic thriller; Blake and Shu cleverly make use of colours, images, ideas in place of speech, and the film has a unique energy all the better for it.\"<ref name=autogenerated2 /> [[The Star (Malaysia)
column4: The Star]] praised Shu as, \"a cinematographer who shoots to make things and people stand out.\"<ref>{{Cite web
column6: title=Cinematographer Darius Shu shoots to make things and people stand out {{!}} The Star Online
column9: The Advocate]] magazine pointed out that, \"the cinematography of ''His Hands'' offers an unnerving experience through dark, haunting images with no dialogue.\"<ref name=autogenerated3 />

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: [[Mark Gatiss]], the producer of [[Netflix]]-[[BBC]] television series [[Dracula (2020 TV series)
column3: Sherlock]], reviewed Shu's film ''His Hands'' as, ''\"A beguilingly beautiful gem, Arron Blake and Darius Shu's His Hands defies easy analysis. Shot through with strange, homoerotic melancholy it's ravishing to look at and haunts the memory long after.\"''<ref>{{Cite web

column3: Utah County]] and the state of [[Utah]]

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: '''Spanish Fork''' is a city in [[Utah County, Utah
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Utah County]], [[Utah]], United States.<ref name=gnis/> It is part of the [[Provo, Utah
column5: Metropolitan Statistical Area]]. The population was 39,961 as of a 2018 estimate.<ref>{{Cite web
column7: title=U.S. Census Bureau QuickFacts: Spanish Fork city, Utah
column10: access-date=2018-11-30}}</ref> Spanish Fork, Utah is the 20th largest city in Utah based on official 2017 estimates from the US Census Bureau.<ref>http://worldpopulationreview.com/us-cities/spanish-fork-ut-population/</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Spanish Fork lies in the [[Utah Valley]], with the [[Wasatch Range]] to the east and [[Utah Lake]] to the northwest. [[Interstate 15 in Utah
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: I-15]] passes the northwest side of the city. [[Payson, Utah
column3: Payson]] is approximately six miles to the southwest, [[Springville, Utah
column4: Springville]] lies about four miles to the northeast, and [[Salem, Utah
column5: Salem]] is approximately 4.5 miles to the south.<ref>''Utah Atlas & Gazetteer,'' DeLorme,  9th ed., 2014, p.25 {{isbn

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Spanish Fork was settled in 1851 by members of [[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints]] as part of the [[Mormon Pioneers
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Mormon Pioneers']] settlement of [[Utah Territory]]. Its name derives from a visit to the area by two [[Franciscan]] friars from [[Spain]], [[Silvestre Vélez de Escalante]] and [[Francisco Atanasio Domínguez]] in 1776, who followed the stream down Spanish Fork canyon with the objective of opening a new trail from [[Santa Fe, New Mexico]], to the [[Spanish missions in California]], along a route later followed by fur trappers.{{Citation needed
column3: date=April 2019}} They described the area inhabited by [[Native Americans in the United States
column4: Native Americans]] as having \"spreading meadows, where there is sufficient irrigable land for two good settlements. Over and above these finest of advantages, it has plenty of firewood and timber in the adjacent sierra which surrounds its many sheltered spots, waters, and pasturages, for raising cattle and sheep and horses.\"{{citation needed

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In 1851, some settlers led by William Pace set up scattered farms in the Spanish Fork bottom lands and called the area the Upper Settlement.<ref name=\"Jenson. p. 823\">Jenson. ''Encyclopedic History''. p. 823</ref> However, a larger group congregated at what became known as the Lower Settlement just over a mile northwest of the present center of Spanish Fork along the [[Spanish Fork River]]. In December 1851, [[Stephen Markham]], who was severely wounded outside [[Carthage Jail]] in [[Carthage, Illinois]] while attempting to defend [[Joseph Smith]] and other church leaders from a mob in 1844, became the [[branch president
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: president]] of the first church congregation (branch) at the Lower Settlement.<ref name=\"Jenson. p. 823\"/>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In 1852, Latter-day Saints founded a settlement called [[Palmyra, Utah
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Palmyra]] west of the historic center of Spanish Fork. [[George A. Smith]] supervised the laying out of a townsite, including a temple square in that year.<ref>Jenson, Andrew. ''Encyclopedic History of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints''. (Salt Lake City: Deseret Book, 1941) p. 631-632</ref> A fort and a school were built at the Palmyra site in 1852.<ref name=\"Jenson. p. 824\">Jenson. ''Encyclopedic History''. p. 824</ref> With the onset of the [[Walkara
column3: Walker War]] in 1853, most of the farmers in the region who were not yet in the Palmyra fort moved in.<ref name=\"Jenson. p. 631\">Jenson. ''Encyclopedic History''. p. 631</ref> Some of the people did not like this site and so moved to a different site at the mouth of Spanish Fork Canyon, where they built a structure they called \"Fort St. Luke\".<ref>Jenson. ''Encyclopedic History''. p. 256-257</ref> Also in 1854 there was a fort founded approximately {{convert
column5: mi}} south of the center of Spanish Fork that later was known as the \"Old Fort\".<ref name=\"Jenson. p. 823\"/>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Between 1855 and 1860, the arrival of pioneers from [[Iceland]] made Spanish Fork the first permanent Icelandic settlement in the United States.<ref>Thorstina Jackson, \"Icelandic Communities in America: Cultural Backgrounds and Early Settlements,\" 681.</ref> The city also lent its name to the 1865 Treaty of Spanish Fork, where the [[Ute people
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Utes]] were forced by an [[Executive order (United States)
column3: Executive Order]] of President [[Abraham Lincoln]] to relocate to the [[Uintah Basin]].{{Citation needed

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Spanish Fork has a [[city manager]] type of government. Seth Perrins is the current city manager, and Tyler Jacobson is the assistant city manager.<ref name=\"manager\">[http://www.spanishfork.org/dept/admin/cmanager/ Spanish Fork City Manager]</ref>{{Dead link

The current mayor, Steve Leifson, was elected in the November 5, 2013 general election.<ref name=\"election\">[http://www.spanishfork.org/newsevents/events/elections/2013/ Spanish Fork 2013 General Election Results]</ref>{{Dead link
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: date=April 2019}} The members of the city council are: Chad Argyle, Stacy Beck, Brandon Gordon, Mike Mendenhall, and Keir Scoubes.<ref name=\"council\">[http://www.spanishfork.org/mayorcouncil/ Spanish Fork Mayor and City Council]</ref>{{Dead link

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: [[File:Festival of Colors at the Krishna Temple near Spanish Fork, Utah 2012.jpg
column3: Festival of Colors at the Sri Sri Radha Krishna Temple in Spanish Fork]]Spanish Fork City hosts five large-scale events each year: Fiesta Days, Icelandic Days, the Harvest Moon Hurrah, the Festival of Lights, and the Festival of Colors.{{Citation needed

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The Icelandic Association of Utah was founded in 1897 and hosts Iceland Days every year. The association picked June because [[Icelandic Independence Day]], or National Day, is June 17.
Spanish Fork was the first Icelandic settlement in the United States, after Icelanders who joined the [[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Church of Jesus Christ]] were expelled from that country, according to association spokesman Glenn Grossman.{{Citation needed
column3: date=April 2019}} Although other nationalities helped found the town, under colonizer [[Brigham Young]], Icelanders kept their identity and celebrate it with their culture every year during the three-day event.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The Harvest Moon Hurrah is sponsored by the Spanish Fork Arts Council and takes place on a Saturday in September closest to the date of the full moon. Activities include children's crafts and activities, a giant paint-it-yourself mural, storyteller, old-fashioned family photos, caricature artist, clown and balloon animals, hay rides with live bluegrass band, and live entertainment. The 2009 Hurrah was headlined by [[Peter Breinholt]], a local musician.<ref name=\"hurrah\">[http://www.spanishfork.org/dept/parkrec/arts/hurrah.php Harvest Moon Hurrah]</ref>{{Dead link

Each year Spanish Fork hosts the \"Fiesta Days\". The event is held every July, and is centered around the Pioneer Day Celebration. There are a number of entertainment events, including a rodeo, craft fair, parade, duck race, and a fireworks show on the 24th.
The [[Sri Sri Radha Krishna Temple (Spanish Fork)
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Sri Sri Radha Krishna Temple]] (erected by Christopher Warden, an [[International Society for Krishna Consciousness]] follower<ref>http://www.utahkrishnas.org/utah-krishna-pioneers-2/</ref>)  celebrates [[Holi]] and is known for the  ''Festival of Colors'' where thousands of people gather from all over the country.<ref>http://www.utahkrishnas.org/festival-colors/</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: As of the [[2010 United States Census
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: 2010 census]], there were 34,691 people, 9,069 households, and 7,885 families residing in the city. The [[population density]] was 2,252.7 people per square mile (871.6/km²). There were 9,440 housing units, at an average density of 613.0 per square mile (237.2/km²). The [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census
column3: racial makeup]] of the city was 90.9% White, 0.4% African American, 0.5% Native American, 0.6% Asian, 0.7% Pacific Islander, 4.4% some other race, and 2.5% from two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 10.6% of the population.<ref name=\"Census 2010\">{{Cite web
column5: title=Profile of General Population and Housing Characteristics: 2010 Demographic Profile Data (DP-1): Spanish Fork city, Utah
column7: access-date=March 8, 2012}}</ref> As for ages, the population was quite young with 40.9% being under the age of 18, 53.6% aged 18–64 and 5.5% over the age of 65.<ref name=\"Quick Facts Spanish Fork city, Utah\">{{Cite web
column9: title=Spanish Fork (Spanish Fork City), Utah — Overview
column14: publisher=United States Census Bureau, Moonshadow Mobile CensusViewer

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: At the 2000 census, the median income for a household in the city was $62,805, and the median income for a family was $64,909. The [[per capita income]] for the city was $17,162. About 4.3% of families and 6.2% of the population were below the [[Poverty threshold

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: text=Mountain Country Foods is currently Spanish Fork's largest private employer with 350 employees. Eight other businesses employ one hundred or more workers: SAPA, Klune Industries, Longview Fibre, Nature's Sunshine, Rocky Mountain Composites, J.C. Penney, Western Wats, and Provo Craft.
column3: date=April 2019}}<ref name=\"SFCED\">[http://www.spanishfork.org/dept/econdev/majorEmployers.php Spanish Fork City Economic Development]</ref>{{Dead link

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Spanish Fork has a predominantly [[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: LDS]] population. There are seventy-four [[Ward (LDS Church)
column3: LDS wards]] in nine [[Stake (Latter Day Saints)#The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
column4: stakes]] in the southern [[Utah Valley]] and a temple, the [[Payson Utah Temple]]<nowiki>, which opened in June 2015.{{</nowiki><ref>[https://churchofjesuschristtemples.org/payson-utah-temple/ The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints Church Temples]</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: There are other churches in town: the [[Presbyterianism
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Presbyterian Church]] established a church and mission day school in 1882. The school functioned until the state school system was inaugurated in the early part of the twentieth century. Today there are nine public elementary schools, two intermediate, and two high schools of the [[Nebo School District]].<ref>http://www.nebo.edu/</ref>
Lutheran]] church, established by immigrants from [[Iceland]], was built on the east bench of Spanish Fork.<ref>{{citation
column14: oclc= 30473917}}</ref> There is also the Faith Baptist Church, a [[Baptists

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Roman Catholic]] church serves the Catholics of southern Utah Valley; many happen to be of [[Italians
column3: Italian]] descent (see [[Utah Italians]]), [[Hispanic]]s, [[Filipino Americans]], and some [[Greek Catholic Church
column6: contribution= The Catholic Church in Utah

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: ISKCON, the international society of Krishna Consciousness, have built a temple in Spanish Fork, run by Caru Das, the temple priest. [[Indian Americans]] form a small but noticeable community in the Spanish Fork-[[Provo, Utah
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Provo]] area (especially in the neighboring town of [[Springville, Utah

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In Utah Valley's historical settlement by immigrants, Scandinavians (most notably [[Icelanders]]); as well as [[Swiss people]]; [[Spanish Americans]], [[Hispanic]]s or [[Hispanic and Latino Americans
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Latino]]s; [[English Americans]], [[Irish Americans]] and [[Scottish Americans]] are prevalent ethnocultural groups in Spanish Fork, and the nearby towns of [[Salem, Utah

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In 1862, Spanish Fork built its first school house. That one room edifice served the city's educational needs for nearly 50 years. In 1910, Spanish Fork built the Thurber School on Main Street. Although it's not used for daily K-12 classes anymore, it still functions as a city office building.<ref>{{cite web
column6: date=April 2019}} Today, Spanish Fork is served by the [[Nebo School District]]. Public schools in this district within Spanish Fork include the following:

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: *Diamond Fork Junior High School (formerly known as Spanish Fork Middle School)
In addition, there is a private girls school, the New Haven School, and a K-12 charter school, the American Leadership Academy.
In September 2008, the Spanish Fork Wind Project was completed.<ref>[http://www.wasatchwind.com/sfwp.html Spanish Fork Wind Project]</ref>{{Dead link
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: date=April 2019}} This project, a 9-turbine wind energy project, can produce up to 18.9 megawatts at full production, and the nine turbines can power up to 6,000 typical homes.<ref>Matthew Rich (October 6th, 2008) [http://newsnet.byu.edu/story.cfm/69673 Spanish Fork wind farm brings alternative energy] BYU NewsNet. Retrieved on 2009-04-08.</ref>{{Dead link
column3: date=April 2019}}<ref>[http://www.deseretnews.com/article/1,5143,700256733,00.html Deseret News (September 6th, 2008)]</ref> It is a utility-scale [[wind farm]] producing electricity from [[wind power in Utah

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Sri Sri Radha Krishna Temple]] (erected by Christopher Warden, an [[International Society for Krishna Consciousness]] follower<ref>http://www.utahkrishnas.org/utah-krishna-pioneers-2/</ref>)  celebrates [[Holi]] and is known for the  ''The Festival of Colors'' where thousands of people gather from all over the country.<ref>http://www.utahkrishnas.org/festival-colors/</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: As of the [[2010 United States Census
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: 2010 census]], there were 34,691 people, 9,069 households, and 7,885 families residing in the city. The [[population density]] was 2,252.7 people per square mile (871.6/km²). There were 9,440 housing units, at an average density of 613.0 per square mile (237.2/km²). The [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census
column3: racial makeup]] of the city was 90.9% White, 0.4% African American, 0.5% Native American, 0.6% Asian, 0.7% Pacific Islander, 4.4% some other race, and 2.5% from two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 10.6% of the population.<ref name=\"Census 2010\">{{Cite web
column5: title=Profile of General Population and Housing Characteristics: 2010 Demographic Profile Data (DP-1): Spanish Fork city, Utah
column7: access-date=March 8, 2012}}</ref> As for ages, the population was quite young with 40.9% being under the age of 18, 53.6% aged 18–64 and 5.5% over the age of 65.<ref name=\"Quick Facts Spanish Fork city, Utah\">{{Cite web

column14: publisher=United States Census Bureau, Moonshadow Mobile CensusViewer

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: At the 2000 census, the median income for a household in the city was $62,805, and the median income for a family was $64,909. The [[per capita income]] for the city was $17,162. About 4.3% of families and 6.2% of the population were below the [[Poverty threshold

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In 1862, Spanish Fork built its first school house. That one room edifice served the city's educational needs for nearly 50 years. In 1910, Spanish Fork built the Thurber School on Main Street. Although it's not used for daily K-12 classes anymore, it still functions as a city office building.<ref>{{cite web
column6: date=April 2019}} Today, Spanish Fork is served by the [[Nebo School District]]. Public schools in this district within Spanish Fork include the following:

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: *Diamond Fork Junior High School (formerly known as Spanish Fork Middle School)
In addition, there is a private girls school, the New Haven School, and a K-12 charter school, the American Leadership Academy.

Retrieved on 2009-04-08.</ref>{{Dead link

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: t=新唐人電視臺}}) is a television broadcaster, founded by [[Falun Gong]] practitioners, based in [[New York City]] with correspondents in over 70 cities worldwide. The station was founded in 2001 as a Chinese-language broadcaster,<ref>{{cite web
column6: date=14 April 2004}}</ref> but has since expanded its language offerings. The company retains a focus on China in its news broadcasts, and frequently covers topics that are censored in Mainland China. Its mission is to \"promote uncensored information on China; to restore and promote traditional Chinese culture; and to facilitate mutual understanding between the East and West\".<ref>https://ntdtv.org/en/aboutus.html</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: NTD was founded in 2001 by [[Falun Gong]] practitioners, with its mission being to offer \"uncensored news\" about China that [[state-controlled media]] would not cover. The station has a regular focus on the promotion of traditional [[Chinese culture]], and devotes extensive news coverage to alleged [[Chinese human rights issues]]. It takes a critical stance on what it considers to be abuses of power by the [[Communist Party of China]].<ref>[http://english.ntdtv.com NTD]</ref>
Since its founding, NTD has expanded to include English, Spanish, [[Japanese language
column4: Hebrew]] and several other language editions. Its content offerings include news and analysis, arts and culture, travel, entertainment news, health and lifestyle, and children's programming.<ref>[http://english.ntdtv.com NTD]</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The station's critical reporting on the [[Communist Party of China]] has prompted censorship by the [[Government of the People's Republic of China
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Chinese government]]. NTD also alleged that the Chinese government interfered with their reporting and business operations.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: NTD began broadcasting via satellite in North America in February 2002. At present, the station's satellite coverage reaches Asia, Europe, and Australia in several languages.

NTD, along with ''[[The Epoch Times]]'' and [[Sound of Hope]], was founded by [[Falun Gong]] practitioners who had emigrated to the West. Many of its staff are Falun Gong adherents who volunteer their time and services. In an interview with the ''[[Wall Street Journal]]'', president Zhong Lee stated that the company's original purpose was to speak out against the Chinese government's [[persecution of Falun Gong]], but that it \"can also play a big role pushing [[democracy in China]].\"<ref name=WSJ-11-15-2007>Chen, Kathy [https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB119508926438693540 Chinese Dissidents Take On Beijing Via Media Empire] ''[[Wall Street Journal]]'' November 15, 2007</ref> The station covers several issues that are taboo in Mainland China, such as official corruption and public health scares, and also provides a platform for Chinese human rights and pro-democracy activists.<ref name=WSJ-11-15-2007/>
The station's broadcasts is capable of reaching 200 million viewers globally, including 50 million in mainland China, according to the ''[[Wall Street Journal]]''.<ref name=wsj>{{cite news
New Tang Dynasty's revenues in 2017 were $18 million, more than double its $7.4 million revenues in 2016, according to reports from the U.S. Internal Revenue Service.<ref>{{Cite web
column3: title=Universal Communications Network Inc - Nonprofit Explorer
column5: first=Mike Tigas, Sisi Wei, Ken Schwencke, Brandon Roberts, Alec Glassford

column3: NTDTV journalist broadcasting from the Royal Swedish Academy in Stockholm, Sweden, at the announcement of [[Mo Yan]] as 2012 Nobel laureate in literature]]

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: NTD broadcasts 24/7, and offers a variety of original and syndicated programming, including news, arts and culture shows, travel, entertainment news, health and lifestyle, and children's programing.<ref>[http://translate.googleusercontent.com/translate_c?hl=en&sl=zh-TW&u=http://www.ntdtv.com/xtr/b5/prog300new.html&prev=/search%3Fq%3Dntdtv%26hl%3Den%26prmd%3Divns&rurl=translate.google.com&twu=1&usg=ALkJrhh4QaQxV3aUa4dnTrjchg3ZAK6eaw NTD]</ref>

The station is best known for its news and analysis segments, which typically contain criticism of the Chinese government, particularly over human rights abuses, including the persecution of [[Falun Gong]].

The ''Wall Street Journal'' reported that the station broke news of [[SARS]] in 2003, three weeks before the Chinese government admitted publicly that there was an epidemic. (It went on to cause at least 774 deaths.) The station offered extensive coverage of democratic [[elections in Taiwan]], and the death of purged former Chinese General Secretary [[Zhao Ziyang]]. The Chinese-language station regularly airs a video version of [[Epoch Times#Nine commentaries on the Communist Party
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: the Nine Commentaries on the Communist Party]], an editorial series offering a strong critique of Chinese Communist Party rule, which is often used as Falun Gong propaganda against the Chinese Communist Party.<ref>{{cite web

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: NTD broadcasts program regularly on its moderated YouTube channels. China Uncensored is moderated by Chris Chappell since September 2012.<ref>{{cite web
column4: website=NTD}}</ref> The program's topics include the latest news about China and the Chinese Communist Party, criticism of the Chinese government and analysis of its state media.<ref name=\"ref-ntd-08\">[https://www.youtube.com/user/NTDChinaUncensored ChinaUncensored, NTD], Youtube.com, retrieved, 29 January 2018</ref> It is broadcast on the Mandarin-language TV broadcast of New Tang Dynasty Television with Chinese subtitles once a week.<ref>[http://www.chinauncensored.tv/about/ China Uncensored is distributed by New Tang Dynasty Television, and broadcasts on its Mandarin-language TV broadcast with Chinese subtitles once a week.]</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: As part of its proclaimed mission to promote “appreciation and awareness of traditional Chinese culture,” NTD organizes and produces a variety of cultural outreach programs, including Chinese classical dance, martial arts, and culinary competitions. The station frames these activities within a context of reviving \"true Chinese cultural and moral traditions that have been lost under Communist Party rule\".
From 2004 to 2006, NTD produced and televised an annual ''Chinese New Year Spectacular'', a performance featuring [[classical Chinese dance]] and [[Chinese music
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: music]]. The show's performances contained ethnic and folk dances, dances depicting [[Chinese legends]] and moral tales, solo musical performances, and messaging and imagery sympathetic to Falun Gong, and included \"artistic representations of the persecution of practitioners\" in China. These shows have since been continued as traveling stage productions by a dedicated organization, [[Shen Yun Performing Arts]].

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In 2008, the station began organizing a series of annual competitions open to ethnic Chinese participants in fields of classical Chinese dance, martial arts, traditional clothing design, painting, music, photography, and [[Chinese cooking]].<ref>NTD, [https://competitions.ntdtv.com/en/index.php  Global Competition Series]. Retrieved February 6, 2011</ref>

NTD's anti-Communist Party stance and reportage on human rights issues in China has led to interference and political pressure from the Chinese Communist Party and its overseas embassies.<ref>{{cite web
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title = Chinese Regime Tries to Crush Cultural Show in Canada
column6: accessdate = 2007-06-13}}</ref> In turn, along with dissuading government officials from attending the New Year's show, the Chinese embassy in the United States accused NTD of being used to \"spread anti-China propaganda\" and \"distorting Chinese culture\".<ref>{{cite web
column8: title=Enjoy the Holidays and Stay away from the so-called \"Chinese New Year Gala\" of the New Tang Dynasty Television
column9: work=[[Chinese Embassy in the United States of America]]

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In January 2007, a theater in South Korea scheduled to host the New Year's performance cancelled their booking at the last minute, which NTD alleged was because China threatened actions against upcoming Korean shows in Mainland China.<ref>{{cite web
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title = Chinese Regime Pressures Seoul to Cancel Cultural Show
column6: accessdate = 2007-06-13}}</ref> It has also been reported that [[NASDAQ]] broke ties with the station around this time after Chinese pressure.<ref>{{cite web
column7: title=Chinese State Security Demanded NASDAQ Eject Network, Cable Says

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In June 2008, media watchdog [[Reporters Without Borders]] (\"RSF\") accused [[Eutelsat]] of closing down transmissions of NTD on June 16 through its [[Eutelsat 33B
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: W5]] satellite to appease the Chinese government,<ref name=\"rsf\">Reporters Without Borders: [http://www.rsf.org/article.php3?id_article=27818 European satellite operator Eutelsat suppresses independent Chinese-language TV station NTD to satisfy Beijing], July 10, 2008, retrieved on 2009-01-19</ref> and appealed to Eutelsat CEO Giuliano Berretta to quickly reverse its decision to suspend NTD's use of Eutelsat. According to RSF, the NTD shutdown was a \"premeditated, politically motivated decision\". RSF stated that they were in possession of a recording of a purported conversation with a Beijing employee of Eutelsat confirming the allegations.<ref name=\"rsf\"/> Eutelsat claimed that the shutdown was due to a technical failure, denied the validity of the conversation,{{citation needed
column3: date=January 2011}} and pointed out in July 2008 that NTD is still being broadcast from the Hot Bird positions.<ref>{{Cite web

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: On August 20, 2008, the [[International Federation of Journalists]] released a statement calling on Eutelsat to restore NTD and three radio stations including ''[[Sound of Hope]]''. The statement accused Eutelsat of bowing down to political pressure, and argued how the approaching Beijing Olympics could have resulted in the Chinese government's increasing pressure to censor the broadcasting of NTD.<ref name=\"ifj\">International Federation of Journalists: [http://europe.ifj.org/en/articles/ifj-calls-on-eutelsat-to-end-bar-on-chinese-ntdtv-broadcasts IFJ Calls on Eutelsat To End Bar on Chinese NTDTV Broadcasts], August 20, 2008, retrieved on 2009-01-19</ref>

The European Parliament also called on Eutelsat to reverse their decision to shut down NTD. Following this, Eutelsat issued a press release and written declaration, denying all charges of censorship against NTD. The company insists that NTD's shutdown resulted solely from the technical failure experienced by W5 satellite, and adds that NTD is being broadcast across Europe via Eutelsat's HOT BIRD video neighbourhood (which unlike W5, cannot be received from China).<ref name=\"eutelsatJan15\">[http://www.eutelsat.com/news/compress/en/2009/html/PR0309/PR0309.html Eutelsat reaffirms to European institutions the irreversible and purely technical nature of the incident resulting in the interruption of consumer broadcasting services through its W5 satellite], January 15, 2009, retrieved on 2009-01-19</ref>

In June 2010 the [[Canadian Prime Minister's Office]] cancelled a press conference that NTD and Epoch Times would have attended, so that Chinese President [[Hu Jintao]] would not come into contact with the broadcaster, allegedly following terms from the Chinese consulate. According to the ''Toronto Star'', such press conferences are usually standard procedure for foreign leaders visiting the Parliament, and the cancellation was seen as an extraordinary measure to keep NTD away from the Chinese President.<ref name=\"star\">Susan Delacourt, [https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/torontog20summit/article/827903--harper-helps-hu-keep-critics-away \"Harper helps Hu keep critics away\"], Fri Jun 25, 2010</ref>

column6: accessdate = 2007-06-13}}</ref> In turn, along with dissuading government officials from attending the New Year's show, the Chinese embassy in the United States accused NTD of being used to \"spread anti-China propaganda\" and \"distorting Chinese culture\".<ref>{{cite web
column8: title=Enjoy the Holidays and Stay away from the so-called \"Chinese New Year Gala\" of the New Tang Dynasty Television
column9: work=[[Chinese Embassy in the United States of America]]

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In January 2007, a theater in South Korea scheduled to host the New Year's performance cancelled their booking at the last minute, which NTD alleged was because China threatened actions against upcoming Korean shows in Mainland China.<ref>{{cite web
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title = Chinese Regime Pressures Seoul to Cancel Cultural Show
column6: accessdate = 2007-06-13}}</ref> It has also been reported that [[NASDAQ]] broke ties with the station around this time after Chinese pressure.<ref>{{cite web
column7: title=Chinese State Security Demanded NASDAQ Eject Network, Cable Says

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In June 2008, media watchdog [[Reporters Without Borders]] (\"RSF\") accused [[Eutelsat]] of closing down transmissions of NTD on June 16 through its [[Eutelsat 33B
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: W5]] satellite to appease the Chinese government,<ref name=\"rsf\">Reporters Without Borders: [http://www.rsf.org/article.php3?id_article=27818 European satellite operator Eutelsat suppresses independent Chinese-language TV station NTD to satisfy Beijing], July 10, 2008, retrieved on 2009-01-19</ref> and appealed to Eutelsat CEO Giuliano Berretta to quickly reverse its decision to suspend NTD's use of Eutelsat. According to RSF, the NTD shutdown was a \"premeditated, politically motivated decision\". RSF stated that they were in possession of a recording of a purported conversation with a Beijing employee of Eutelsat confirming the allegations.<ref name=\"rsf\"/> Eutelsat claimed that the shutdown was due to a technical failure, denied the validity of the conversation,{{citation needed
column3: date=January 2011}} and pointed out in July 2008 that NTD is still being broadcast from the Hot Bird positions.<ref>{{Cite web

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: On August 20, 2008, the [[International Federation of Journalists]] released a statement calling on Eutelsat to restore NTD and three radio stations including ''[[Sound of Hope]]''. The statement accused Eutelsat of bowing down to political pressure, and argued how the approaching Beijing Olympics could have resulted in the Chinese government's increasing pressure to censor the broadcasting of NTD.<ref name=\"ifj\">International Federation of Journalists: [http://europe.ifj.org/en/articles/ifj-calls-on-eutelsat-to-end-bar-on-chinese-ntdtv-broadcasts IFJ Calls on Eutelsat To End Bar on Chinese NTDTV Broadcasts], August 20, 2008, retrieved on 2009-01-19</ref>

The European Parliament also called on Eutelsat to reverse their decision to shut down NTD. Following this, Eutelsat issued a press release and written declaration, denying all charges of censorship against NTD. The company insists that NTD's shutdown resulted solely from the technical failure experienced by W5 satellite, and adds that NTD is being broadcast across Europe via Eutelsat's HOT BIRD video neighbourhood (which unlike W5, cannot be received from China).<ref name=\"eutelsatJan15\">[http://www.eutelsat.com/news/compress/en/2009/html/PR0309/PR0309.html Eutelsat reaffirms to European institutions the irreversible and purely technical nature of the incident resulting in the interruption of consumer broadcasting services through its W5 satellite], January 15, 2009, retrieved on 2009-01-19</ref>

In June 2010 the [[Canadian Prime Minister's Office]] cancelled a press conference that NTD and Epoch Times would have attended, so that Chinese President [[Hu Jintao]] would not come into contact with the broadcaster, allegedly following terms from the Chinese consulate. According to the ''Toronto Star'', such press conferences are usually standard procedure for foreign leaders visiting the Parliament, and the cancellation was seen as an extraordinary measure to keep NTD away from the Chinese President.<ref name=\"star\">Susan Delacourt, [https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/torontog20summit/article/827903--harper-helps-hu-keep-critics-away \"Harper helps Hu keep critics away\"], Fri Jun 25, 2010</ref>

2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: owner            = New Tang Dynasty Television Canada

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: NTD Television Canada officially launched on [[Rogers Cable]] on September 30, 2008,<ref>{{cite web
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title=NTD Television Canada's official launch on Rogers in September, 2008
column4: date=October 16, 2008 }}</ref> on [[Bell Fibe TV]] in 2010, and on [[Shaw Communications
column5: Shaw Cable]] on March 28, 2012. It is also available on [[Novus Entertainment]] in Vancouver.<ref>{{cite web
column6: title=New Tang Dynasty Multi-Language Channel Launched on Shaw Cable systems in Western Canada

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: On July 25, 2012, NTD Television officially launched '''NTD Canada''', a local Canadian channel for Chinese viewers in Canada.<ref>{{cite web
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: title=New Tang Dynasty Multi-Language Channel Launched on Shaw Cablesystems in Western Canada
column7: df=mdy-all}}</ref> NTD Canada is a multilingual service airing programming in [[Standard Cantonese
column11: French]], with the aim of reaching out to second- and third-generation [[Chinese-Canadians]] who may not speak Chinese as well as they do English or French.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: A widely viewed [[YouTube]] video channel produced by NTD called ''Edge of Wonder'' has been criticized for spreading [[pseudoscience]] and the right-wing U.S. [[conspiracy theory]] [[QAnon]].<ref name=\":0\">{{Cite web
column3: title=This massive YouTube channel is normalizing QAnon
column9: title=Trump, QAnon and an impending judgment day: Behind the Facebook-fueled rise of The Epoch Times
column12: access-date=2019-08-28}}</ref> A critical article in ''[[The Daily Dot]]'' in August 2019 said the ''Edge of Wonder'' hosts \"embrace QAnon completely\" even though \"almost nothing QAnon has foretold has actually taken place.\" ''The Daily Dot'' article pointed to incidents of violence by QAnon believers; a host of ''Edge of Wonder'', Ben Chasteen, responded that \"true researchers of Q would never take any violent action against the American people or any other kind of race.\"<ref name=\":0\" />

subdivision_type2        = [[List of counties in North Carolina

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: '''Pittsboro''' is a town in [[Chatham County, North Carolina
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Chatham County]], [[North Carolina]], United States. The population was 3,743 at the 2010 census<ref name=\"Census 2010\">{{cite web
column7: title=Geographic Identifiers: 2010 Demographic Profile Data (G001): Pittsboro town, North Carolina
column9: accessdate=December 29, 2014}}</ref> and estimated to 4,287 at the 2018 Population Estimates Program (PEP) of the U.S. Census Bureau. It is the [[county seat]] of Chatham County.<ref name=\"GR6\">{{cite web

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Pittsboro was established as a town in 1785. The Chatham County Court House was built on land belonging to Mial Scurlock, but in 1787 the legislature declared that a town could not be established on Scurlock's land. The town's trustees instead purchased adjacent land belonging to William Petty and laid out the town. That same year, Pittsboro was officially named the county seat. Although Chatham County is named for [[William Pitt, 1st Earl of Chatham]], Pittsboro is named for his son, [[William Pitt the Younger]].
Pittsboro was once considered as a site for both the [[University of North Carolina]] and the state capital. The university was established in [[Chapel Hill, North Carolina
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Chapel Hill]], beginning in 1789. The state capital is [[Raleigh, North Carolina

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: As the county seat, Pittsboro has been a center of trade and local government, including the courts. Many farmers would come into town on the weekend for trade. In 1881 a new county courthouse and jail were built in Pittsboro.

The area did not have large plantations, but farmers also depended on slave labor. In 1860 nearly one-third of the county population was made up of enslaved African Americans. After the Civil War and [[emancipation]], whites used violence and other means to enforce [[white supremacy]] and suppress the freedmen's vote. The [[Ku Klux Klan]] and other supremacist groups were active in the county.<ref name=\"huber\" />
In 1885 Pittsboro was the scene of a notorious mass [[Lynching in the United States
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: lynching of four African Americans]], including a woman, that earned statewide condemnation. They were tenant farmers. A masked mob took Jerry Finch, his wife Harriet, and Lee Tyson from jail, where they were being held after arrest as suspects in a robbery/murder case.<ref name=\"huber\">[https://www.jstor.org/stable/23522619 Patrick J. Huber, \"Caught Up in the Violent Whirlwind of Lynching\": The 1885 Quadruple Lynching in Chatham County, North Carolina], ''The North Carolina Historical Review'', Vol. 75, No. 2 (APRIL 1998), pp. 135-160; via JSTOR; accessed 09 June 2018</ref> Harriet Finch was one of four black women to be lynched in the state.<ref name=\"baker\">[https://www.ncpedia.org/lynching Bruce E. Baker, \"Lynching\"], 2006, ''Encyclopedia of North Carolina'', ed. by William S. Powell; accessed 09 June 2018</ref> They also took and hanged John Pattishall, who was awaiting trial for two other unrelated robbery/murders.<ref name=\"burke\">[https://uncw.edu/csurf/Explorations/documents/withoutdueprocess.pdf Sarah Burke, \"Without Due Process: Lynching in North Carolina 1880-1900\"], ''Explorations'', n.d., University of North Carolina Wilmington; accessed 09 June 2018</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Violence continued during the stress of economic hard times at the end of the century and into the early 20th century, when the state [[Disfranchisement after Reconstruction era
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: disenfranchised most blacks]]. This political exclusion lasted until after 1965 and passage of the [[Voting Rights Act]].  In 2019, a statue erected in 1907 of a Confederate soldier outside the [[Chatham County Courthouse]] in Pittsboro was taken down.<ref>[https://www.newsobserver.com/news/local/counties/chatham-county/article237568224.html Confederate monument at the center of protests in Chatham County taken down]</ref><ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/20/us/pittsboro-confederate-statue.html Confederate Statue in North Carolina Comes Down After 112 Years]</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: During the previous decade, textile mills in the north-central area of the county along the Haw River, Rocky River, and Deep River provided new manufacturing jobs to workers who had lost farm holdings due to economic depressions of the 1870s and early 1880s. It was the beginning of industrialization around Pittsboro.

On March 25, 2010, the [[Chatham County Courthouse]] (pictured below), while undergoing a $415,000 exterior renovation, caught fire. Smoke was first reported in the area around 4:15 p.m.; the fire was dispatched to the Pittsboro Fire Department around 4:45 p.m. By 5 p.m., smoke was reported to be rising from out of the clock tower, which was surrounded by scaffolds. The building was evacuated safely.

The building suffered severe damage to the clock tower and the third floor. It was reported that the fire had destroyed all the computers and records, but there were offsite copies and the information was recoverable.<ref>{{cite web
column3: title=Fire severely damages Chatham County courthouse :: WRAL.com

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: On March 26, 2010, at approximately 1:30 a.m., the clock tower collapsed onto the main building, but the building as a whole was damaged only on the second floor. Damage in the rest of the building was from water and smoke effects. Overall 11 fire departments participated in the fire efforts.

column4: Viewed from the west-northwest, the Chatham County Court House in August 2013, having been rebuilt after a fire destroyed the upper floors and clock tower.]]

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The fire marshal's investigation into the fire determined that it was caused by a [[soldering]] torch that ignited wood near the [[soffit]]. Workers attempted to extinguish the blaze, but were unsuccessful. On March 31, 2010, the Chatham County Commissioners voted to rebuild the courthouse.<ref>{{cite web
column3: title=Chatham commissioners vote to rebuild courthouse :: WRAL.com
column8: accessdate=31 January 2017}}</ref> It reopened on April 20, 2013.<ref>http://www.newsobserver.com/2013/04/20/2839308/historic-chatham-county-courthouse.html</ref>

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The mayor of Pittsboro is elected [[at-large]]. The current mayor is James W. Nass. The town's five members of the Board of Commissioners are also elected [[at-large]]. They are Pamela Baldwin, J.A. (Jay) Farrell, Kyle Shipp, John Bonitz, and Michael A. Fiocco.

Pittsboro holds elections for the Mayor and three seats on the Board of Commissioners every four years in the off-year after each midterm election. Two Pittsboro Commissioners are elected in the off-year after each presidential election.<ref>{{cite web

Pittsboro Police is directed by Chief Percy Crutchfield. Serving Pittsboro's 4,000 residents, the department comprises 8 patrolmen, 1 community police officer, 1 lead investigator and 1 lieutenant.<ref>{{cite web
The town is served by four local schools and a Central Carolina Community College campus:
*[[Central Carolina Community College]] (CCCC), Chatham County Campus
Pittsboro is located east of the center of Chatham County at {{coord

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: The [http://censusviewer.com/city/NC/Pittsboro/ Census of 2010] shows a population of 3,743, 68% growth since 2000. The racial makeup of the town was: 72% [[White (U.S. Census)
column3: African American]], 4% some other race alone, 2% two or more races. Almost 9% of the population was [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)
column5: Latino]]. 54% of the population is female and 46% male.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: As of the [[census]]<ref name=\"GR2\" /> of 2000, there were 2,226 people, 855 households, and 535 families residing in the town. The [[population density]] was 663.1 people per square mile (255.8/km²). There were 939 housing units at an average density of 279.7 per square mile (107.9/km²). The racial makeup of the town was 64.38 percent [[White (U.S. Census)
column6: Pacific Islander]], 4.99 percent from [[Race (United States Census)
column7: other races]], and 1.89 percent from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)
column9: Latino]] of any race were 8.81 percent of the population.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: There were 855 households out of which 29.0 percent had children under the age of 18 living with them, 40.9 percent were [[Marriage
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: married couples]] living together, 18.7 percent had a female householder with no husband present, and 37.4 percent were non-families. 32.3 percent of all households were made up of individuals and 12.7 percent had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.34 and the average family size was 2.97.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: In the town, the population was spread out with 22.9% under the age of 18, 7.3 percent from 18 to 24, 28.7 percent from 25 to 44, 19.6 percent from 45 to 64, and 21.5 percent who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 39 years. For every 100 females, there were 80.7 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 75.0 males.

The median income for a household in the town was $35,800, and the median income for a family was $42,391. Males had a median income of $29,500 versus $26,719 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the town was $16,863. About 19.2 percent of families and 18.3 percent of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 24.3 percent of those under age 18 and 13.7 percent of those age 65 or over.

Once home to [[textile]]s, the largest clothing label mill in the world, and [[poultry]], the town now depends on commuter income, retail stores and a developing business in [[genetics]]. Housing developments provide relief from loss of industry as the town adjusts to a new economy.
The water supply is abundant, derived from the [[Haw River]]. In the future, Jordan Lake will provide much of the water supply. In 2010, the wastewater allotment was expanded. The town is {{convert
column5: mi}} from major power plants. Major corridor highways, US 15-501 and US 64, a four-lane divided highway, intersect there.

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: Pittsboro is home to the Chatham County Government, the Chatham County Justice Center, and many non-profit agencies and other social service organizations. Pittsboro is also a Certified Retirement Community.
*[[William Joseph Franks]] (1830-1880), United States Navy sailor who received the Medal of Honor for his actions in the American Civil War
*[[Charles M. Stedman]] (1841-1930), the last [[American Civil War
2020 single by Camila Cabello featuring: Civil War]] veteran to serve in Congress

,safe,Ss112,"{{short description: *[[James Iredell Waddell]] (1824-1886), officer in the United States Navy and later in the Confederate States Navy

* [http://www.hawriver.org Haw River Assembly], local conservation organization
